description.short: Tries to fix duplicate entries in the mod list.
description.long:
[size=4][b]Introduction
[/b][/size]
This is an extension for Vortex that tries to restore the binding between a mod and the archive it was installed from after that connection was severed somehow.

[size=4][b]The problem

[/b][/size]Mod and archive are connected through the archive id that is randomly generated the moment Vortex "gets to know" the archive. Now if, for example, you move downloads around, Vortex will not know it's the same file being moved. It will instead consider the old archive deleted and a new archive (with the same name) created - which then gets a new id. Any bindings to mods will then be lost and Vortex will consider the archive as a new, not yet installed, mod.

[size=4][b]The solution

[/b][/size]The way this extension works is by finding all mods that are bound to archives that no longer exist, then use a search based on the file name for archives that could be the origin. At least mods that were downloaded from Nexus Mods should have fairly unique names so this way of matching should work fine.

[size=4][b]How to install
[/b][/size]
Open the extensions tab in vortex (requires advanced mode) and drag the 7z file onto the drop zone at the bottom.

[size=4][b]Usage[/b]
[/size]
After installation find the "Fix Bindings" button on the mods page.

description.short: Adds a button to Vortex to open the chrome developer tools.
description.long:
[b][size=4]Description[/size][/b]

This extension adds a button to the global menu in the top right of Vortex to open the chrome developer tools.

[b][size=4]Who is this for
[/size][/b]
This can be useful if you try to write a theme for Vortex and need to identify controls. It can also be very useful to help us find bugs or performance problems.

[b][size=4]Compatibility
[/size][/b]
Should be compatible with all versions of Vortex.

[b][size=4]How to install
[/size][/b]
Open the extensions tab in vortex (requires advanced mode) and drag the 7z file onto the drop zone at the bottom.

description.short: Helps in creating translations for Vortex.
description.long:
[size=4][b]Introduction[/b]
[/size]
This is an extension for Vortex that tries to make the translation to different languages easier.

[size=4][b]The problem
[/b]
[/size]Unfortunately we can't provide a full translation table that you can just fill out. This extension helps you identifying untranslated parts for your active language.

[size=4][b]How to install
[/b][/size]
Open the extensions tab in vortex (requires advanced mode) and drag the 7z file onto the drop zone at the bottom.

[size=4][b]Usage[/b]
[/size]
After installation you will find a new section in Settings->Interface.
To start translating, select the Language in the drop down box.
From now on, as you click through Vortex it will automatically add missing translation to the translation files at [i]c:\users\<username>\Vortex\locales\<language id>[/i] and when you make changes to that translation they become visible in Vortex as soon as you save (with very few exceptions).

[size=4][b]More[/b][/size]

More help can be found in this forum thread: [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/6539436-translating-vortex/]https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/6539436-translating-vortex/[/url]

description.short: A Vortex mod manager magyarítása.
description.long:
Ez a Vortex nevű mod manager program magyarítása. A Vortex fejlesztése még folyamatban van, rendszeres az új funkciók hozzáadása, ezért időnként megváltozhatnak benne a korábban lefordított szövegek. Illetve tudni kell, hogy néhány üzenetet sajnos nem lehet lefordítani ebben a programban. (De az 1.23-as változatban elég sokat sikerült, amit eddig nem lehetett.)

Elder Scrolls játékoknál a modok "bevetéséhez" rögzített hivatkozás ajánlott (hardlink deployment, ismertetőt lásd a programban az i ikonra kattintva), de az erről szóló hibaüzenetet sem lehetett lefordítani. Annyi a teendő, hogy telepítési könyvtárnak olyat adj meg a Beállítások-Modok lapon, ami ugyanazon a partíción van, mint a játék. (Ha pl. a Skyrim a D:\SteamLibrary\SteamApps\common\Skyrim könyvtárban van, akkor a Skyrim modok telepítési útvonala valami ilyesmi legyen: D:\Vortex_mods\Skyrim)

[size=3][b]TELEPÍTÉS
[/b][/size]
A magyarítás telepítését a Vortex magától elvégzi. Használni pedig úgy lehet, hogy a Settings-Interface lapon a Language lenyíló menüben kiválasztod a magyar nyelvet. Ha el akarnád távolítani, a Kiterjesztések között ki lehet kapcsolni.

[size=3][b]IMPORTÁLÁS NMM-BŐL, MO-BÓL[/b]

[/size]A Vortex egy külön telepített programként kerül a számítógépedre. Nincs hatása a már létező Nexus Mod Manager illetve Mod Organizer telepítésedre. Az egyetlen dolog, amit befolyásolhatsz ezekkel kapcsolatban, a "Download with Manager" gombok működése a Nexusmods oldalon. Ha akarod, beállíthatod, hogy ezekre a gombokra kattintva a Vortex induljon el és töltse le a kiválasztott modot.

A Modok menü tetején található egy "Importálás..." ikon, abban pedig "Importálás NMM-ből" és "Importálás MO-ból" menüpontok vannak. Ezekre kattintva, az útmutatót követve lemásolhatod az adott programban (Nexus Mod Manger vagy Mod Organizer) található mod beállításaidat. Ez nem befolyásolja az adott programok működését. Légy türelemmel, amíg tart a folyamat, nagyobb méretű mod csomagok esetén eltarthat egy darabig, amíg végez. Ha sikeres volt az importálás, akkor célszerű bezárni a Vortexet, és Nexus Mod Manager esetén átváltani egy üres profilra/kikapcsolni az összes modot. Erre azért van szükség, mert a NMM elavult módon próbálja nyomon követni, hogy milyen modokat használsz vele, ami összeakadhat a Vortex dolgaival. Ha később vissza akarnál térni a NMM-hez, akkor egyszerűen ki kell kapcsolnod a modokat a Vortexben/üres profilra kell váltanod, majd a Nexus Mod Managerben vissza kell váltanod az eredeti profilodra.

[b]VÉGÜL NÉHÁNY JÓ TANÁCS
[/b]
Ha mondjuk a Skyrim indításánál azonnal összeomlik a játék még a főmenü előtt, és magyarítást használsz, nézz utána, hogy megvannak-e még a Skyrim\Data\Strings mappában a szükséges dolgok. Nálam előfordult, hogy bizonyos modok kikapcsolása miatt törölte őket a Vortex (hiszen ezek hozzá tartoznak), nélkülük viszont nem működik a magyarítással a játék. De olyan eset is előfordult, hogy meg kellett szüntetni az internet kapcsolatot a Skyrim indítása előtt, csak úgy indult el. (Ez a Skyrim Különleges Kiadásnál jellemző, ha nem használsz Engine Fixes modot.)

description.short: A selection of themes for Vortex, based on the colour schemes of your favourite Nexus Mods game sites..
description.long:
A selection of themes for Vortex, based on the colour schemes of your favourite Nexus Mods game sites.

[size=6][font=bebas_neuebook]Included Themes[/font][/size]

Burgundy - Used on the Witcher 2 and Witcher 3 mod sites
Deep Blue - Used on the Skyrim Special Edition mod site
Deep Orange - Used on the Fallout: New Vegas mod site
Fallout Green - Used on the Fallout 3 and Fallout 4 mod sites
Gold - Used on the Elder Scrolls Online mod site
Pale Brown - Used on the Morrowind mod site
Sepia - Used on the Dark Souls, Dark Souls 2 and Mount & Blade mod sites
Skyrim Blue - Used on the Skyrim mod site
Teal - Used on the No Man's Sky and XCOM 2 mod sites
Violet Blue - Used on the Neverwinter Nights and Neverwinter Nights 2 mod sites


[size=6][font=bebas_neuebook]Installation[/font][/size]

Close Vortex before installing.

Open up "AppData\Roaming\Vortex\Themes".

[b][i]Note: If you used Shared mode under Settings -> Vortex your themes folder will be C:\ProgramData\vortex\themes[/i][/b]

Copy the folders of the colours you want into this directory.

Open Vortex and navigate to Settings -> Themes and select the colour you want to use.


[size=6][font=bebas_neuebook]Uninstallation[/font][/size]

Ensure you change to a different theme than the one you wish to remove.

Close Vortex.

Open the themes folder.

Delete the folder of the theme you no longer want. 

Start Vortex.

description.short: Just a simple re-skin of Vortex to my own tastes.
description.long:
[size=6]Installation[/size]

Open Vortex and navigate to Settings -> Themes and select 'vuix'.


[size=6]Uninstallation[/size]

Ensure you change to a different theme than the one you wish to remove.

Close Vortex.

Open the themes folder.

Delete the 'vuix' folder. 

Start Vortex.

description.short:
This is a Spanish translation for Vortex.
I strongly encourage you to find any grammatical errors and point them out.
description.long:
English:
This is a Spanish translation for Vortex.
I strongly encourage you to find any grammatical errors and point them out.

Translations should go in C:\Users\YourUserName\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales

I have tried to adapt to spanish the best i could,  there are words for things that while have a lot of sense in english and there exist an actual direct translation for that word, in spanish that word does not have all the meanings, or worse, there are no single words that can have that meaning, soo in that cases i was forced to change it to a small phrase, like in the case of deployement, in spanish is "desplegar" and while is a very direct translation, the meaning in vortex was no good in spanish and was a very alien way of saying it, so i changes it for "Agregar al Juego" in english "Add it to the game", is not that "desplegar" was not correct, but it was a confusing way of saying it, please tell me suggestions to improve the translations. There are parts that i cannot translate even whit the plugin because it simply doesnt detect it, and even when i try to manually add it to the file, it doesnt work.


Spanish:
Esta es una traduccion al español de Vortex.
Por favor, ruego ser informado de errores de ortografia y gramaticales, sobretodo encontrareis una gran ausencia de tildes.

Las traducciones se instalan en C:\Users\TuNombreDeUsuario\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales

He intentado adaptarlo al español lo mejor que he podido, pero siempre hay palabras que mientras que tienen varios sentidos en ingles, no tienen todos los sentidos en español e incluso peor, puede no haber ninguna sola palabra que pueda sustituir uno de esos sentidos en español de forma clara en algunos casos, como en el caso de desplegar, esta palabra se usa dentro de vortex para referirse a lo que pasa cuando despues de instalar un juego, vortex añade los archivos al juego, si bien no es que desplegar este mal, es una forma un tanto alien de decirlo y no es nada clara, por lo que la he cambiado por Agregar al Juego, Agregando al juego, etc, que dentro de la interfaz es lo que tiene mas sentido, por favor aparte de los errores, agradeceria sugerencias para mejorar la traduccion. Aparte es tan completa como he podido, hay cosas que no he conseguido que me acepte la traduccion o partes que quizas podrian estar mejor expresadas.

description.short:
This is a Swedish translation for Vortex.
I strongly encourage you to find any grammatical errors and point them out.
description.long:
This is a Swedish translation for Vortex.
I strongly encourage you to find any grammatical errors and point them out.

UPDATE: Translations should go in C:\Users\YourUserName\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales

I have tried to have the intent of the English as provided by Tannin to reflect in the Swedish language. As sometimes a English word can mean several things. 
UPDATE: You can discover missing translations using the translation extension. See more here:

https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/6539436-translating-vortex/

It's also impossible to choose translation as type of file as Nexus Mods claims that the Vortex mod could not be found. (For the time being). And there is no Translations category currently. Sorry.

Read comments for any news regarding the translation.

description.short: French Translation for Vortex.
description.long:
[center][size=5][b]ATTENTION. CETTE TRADUCTION EST OBSOLETE ET NE SERA PLUS MISE A JOUR. POUR OBTENIR LA VERSION MISE A JOUR,[/b][/size]
[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/48]CLIQUEZ ICI[/url]﻿[/size]

[b][size=4]Un grand merci à aogara d'avoir repris le flambeau pour cette traduction.
Dorénavant, c'est sur sa page que vous trouverez la dernière version.[/size][/b][/center]

[center]﻿[/center][center]﻿[/center][center][b]IMPORTANT :

Cette traduction a été effectuée à l'aide d'un plug-in bien pratique permettant d'ajouter les lignes à traduire directement en les survolant avec la souris. Cependant certaines lignes ne se rajoutent pas et je ne suis pas parvenu à les ajouter manuellement non plus (notamment certaines listes dropdown)[/b][/center]
[center][b]En tenant compte de ce qui a été écrit plus haut, je tiens à préciser que n'importe quel conseil avisé sur où trouver les lignes manquantes pour les traduire est plus que bienvenu, tout comme les habituelles remarques sur les fautes ou erreurs de n'importe quel type (mais toujours en lien avec la traduction).



[/b][/center]
[center][b]INSTALLATION :[/b][/center]

NOTE: A partir de la version 0.17.11, l'installeur n'est plus utilisé (pour plusieurs raisons). Pour installer manuellement la traduction, voici les étapes:

Extrayez l'archive où bon vous semble puis placez le dossier "fr" dans:
[i]C:\Utilisateurs\<VotreNom>\AppData\Roaming\vortex\locales[/i]
Pensez bien à placer le [b]DOSSIER[/b] "fr" dans le dossier "locales" pas juste son contenu. Celui-ci contient toutes les traductions.

Après l'installation, pour activer la langue, il vous suffit de lancer Vortex puis de vous rendre dans l'onglet "Settings" à gauche et de sélectionner la langue française dans la liste déroulante.

[/size][size=3]3.[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/29?tab=files]下载翻译文件[/url]，把解压出来的，名为 zh 的文件夹丢到 locales 文件夹里！

[img]http://ww1.sinaimg.cn/large/5ea3e879ly1fzc0jjc9ozj20ey05udgw.jpg[/img]
[/size][code]﻿[/code]
[size=3]4.打开Vortex，进入：SETTINGS-INTERFACE-LANGUAGE选择中文
[/size]
[img]http://ww1.sinaimg.cn/large/5ea3e879ly1fzc0kegdfvj20df08uaar.jpg[/img][/quote]

教程引用自[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/29?tab=description]旧版[/url]﻿，部分翻译参考旧版

之后会在Github进行开源，方便完善

description.short: Traduzione italiana di Vortex, il nuovo gestore di mod di Nexus Mods.
description.long:
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/26/26-1537874238-1564287998.png[/img]


[b][size=6]INSTALLAZIONE
[/size][/b]
Non è necessario scaricare e installare manualmente questo pacchetto. L'intero processo verrà automatizzato da Vortex seguendo la procedura sottostante. Vi invito comunque a effettuare il download una prima volta per lasciare un "endorsement".

[list]
[*]Installa [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]Vortex[/url]﻿.
[*]Avvia Vortex e scegli la lingua italiana dalle impostazioni.
[*]Riavvia Vortex.
[/list]
[i]Attenzione: la traduzione fa affidamento a strumenti creati dalla community per estrarre i testi originali. Alcune parti del programma potrebbero non essere tradotte.[/i]


[size=6][b]CHE COS'È VORTEX?[/b][/size]

Vortex è il nuovo gestore di mod all'avanguardia di Nexus Mods. È progettato per consentire ai nuovi utenti di modificare facilmente i loro giochi, dando al contempo abbastanza controllo ai veterani della scena del modding. Sotto la guida di Tannin, il creatore di Mod Manager, Vortex fa tesoro degli insegnamenti appresi durante lo sviluppo di MO e Nexus Mod Manager per offrire la più potente e intuitiva esperienza di modding di sempre. 
Il nostro approccio con Vortex è concentrato allo sviluppo di funzioni complesse, ad esempio cambiare l'ordine di caricamento o gestire le mod, automatizzando il più possibile il processo, con l'obiettivo di arrivare col minimo sforzo a una versione modificata del gioco. Vogliamo aiutarti a passare meno tempo a modificare giochi e più tempo a giocarli. 


[b][size=6]PERCHÉ VORTEX?[/size][/b]

[size=4][b]SUPPORTO PER GIOCHI MULTIPLI[/b][/size]
Supporto a mod per oltre 30 giochi diversi, in costante aumento. Da Dark Souls, Fallout e Skyrim fino alla saga di The Witcher e Stardew Valley. Vortex è il più versatile gestore di mod esistente.
[size=4]
[b]STRETTA INTEGRAZIONE CON NEXUS MODS[/b][/size]
Vortex è progettato per interagire perfettamente con Nexus Mods, consentendoti di trovare, installare e giocare facilmente mod dal nostro sito, scoprendo nuovi contenuti e le ultime notizie.

[size=4][b]GESTIONE SEMPLIFICATA DELLE MOD[/b][/size]
Il sistema di ordinamento automatico integrato gestisce il tuo ordine di caricamento e ti aiuta a risolvere i conflitti tra mod con funzioni di gestione dei plugin potenti ma facili da usare.

[size=4][b]PROFILI DI MOD[/b][/size]
L'organizzazione, la gestione individuale e il passaggio da un profilo di mod all'altro ti permette di usare l'esatta combinazione di mod che desideri per una particolare partita.

[size=4][b]INTERFACCIA MODERNA E INTUITIVA[/b][/size]
Vortex dispone di un'interfaccia completamente personalizzabile, permettendoti di accedere facilmente e rapidamente agli strumenti, alla gestione dei tuoi
giochi, dei plugin, dei download e dei salvataggi.
[size=4]
[b]ESTENSIONI E PLUGIN[/b][/size]
Vortex viene rilasciato sotto licenza GPL-3, dando alla community la possibilità di scrivere estensioni e framework che possono interagire con Vortex, accrescendo le sue funzionalità.


[size=6][b]GIOCHI SUPPORTATI[/b][/size]

Attualmente Vortex supporta numerosi titoli, più altri che vengono aggiunti dai nostri sviluppatori e dalla community di Nexus Mods. Laddove vedi il pulsante "Mod Manager Download" sul nostro sito, vuol dire che Vortex può gestire quella mod. 

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/images/2295/31179975-1537873128.jpg[/img]


[size=6][b]VORTEX SOSTITUISCE NEXUS MOD MANAGER, MOD ORGANIZER, O ALTRI GESTORI DI MOD?[/b][/size]

Non ci aspettiamo che tutti passino subito a Vortex, ma sentiamo che è pronto per essere provato. Se al momento hai una configurazione di mod stabile con un gestore di mod alternativo puoi usare quello, ma potresti trovare in Vortex una valida alternativa per la tua prossima configurazione.

Molti utenti hanno eseguito il passaggio completo durante l'alfa tra febbraio e ottobre 2018. Ci sarà una lieve curva di apprendimento per abituarsi alla modalità d'uso di Vortex, ma speriamo che il sistema di aiuto e assistenza integrato ti aiuterà ad adattarti facilmente. Vortex dispone di tutte le funzioni di cui hai bisogno per modificare i giochi. Se manca qualcosa di importante, faccelo sapere nei forum così da poterlo migliorare. 

Tenendo conto di tutto questo, abbiamo sostituito ufficialmente NMM sul sito, inclusi il pulsante di download e il link nell'intestazione del sito. Puoi scaricare Vortex e le sue traduzioni o estensioni dalla nostra pagina dei giochi di [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site]Nexus Mods[/url].


[size=6][b]AIUTO E ASSISTENZA[/b][/size]

Vortex è ora il gestore di mod principale di Nexus Mods e intendiamo fornire assistenza ai nostri utenti. Puoi vedere la nostra [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Category:Vortex]sezione dedicata all'assistenza[/url] per Vortex, visitare i [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/forum/4301-vortex/]forum di Vortex[/url] o dare un'occhiata a uno dei nostri topic d'assistenza qui sotto in primo piano.

[list]
[*][url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Frequently_Asked_Questions]Domande frequenti su Vortex[/url]
[*][url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Migrating_to_Vortex_from_another_Mod_Manager]Come passare da un altro gestore di mod a Vortex[/url]﻿
[*][url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php?title=User-Interface-Overview]Interfaccia utente: panoramica[/url]﻿
[/list]

[size=6][b]FEEDBACK[/b][/size]

Vortex integra nel software un sistema di raccolta feedback e di segnalazione degli errori, accessibile mediante il menu nell'angolo in alto a destra. In caso Vortex si blocchi, avrai un'opzione di segnalazione simile. Se noti problemi con l'uso del software, segnalacelo usando queste modalità, fornendoci informazioni dettagliate su ciò che stavi facendo quando si è verificato il problema. È il modo più immediato per comunicare con Tannin e per trovare e correggere gli errori.


[size=6][b]PER GLI SVILUPPATORI[/b][/size]

Il codice sorgente è disponibile su [url=https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex]GitHub[/url]﻿.
Ulteriori informazioni sulla struttura del codice, sulla sua estensione e altro si trovano sui [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/forum/4311-vortex-code-development/]forum di sviluppo del codice di Vortex[/url].

description.short: This file is Japanese translation for Vortex. This file contains locales/ja/*.json files.
description.long:
[b][color=#f1c232][size=5][u]Japanese Translation for Vortex (Vortex日本語化ファイル)[/u][/size][/color][/b]

バージョン: 1.3.5 (1.3.6～1.3.8でも利用可能)
最終更新日: 2020/09/11
制作: BowmoreLover

[size=3][color=#f1c232][u][b]お知らせ[/b][/u][/color][/size]

[color=#ffff00][b]2020/06/22:[/b][/color]
Vortex 1.2.15以降で日本語拡張機能をインストールしようとすると、"Invalid Extension"という赤い通知メッセージが出てインストールできない問題が発生していましたが、6/22にリリースされた Vortex 1.2.17にて対策されました。。
暫定対策版 "Japanese Translation for Vortex 1.2.15-r2" を導入済みで、Vortex 1.2.17以降にアップデートした場合、次の手順で暫定対策版をアンインストールしてください。
(1) 拡張機能ページで "Japanese Translation for Vortex 1.2.15-r2" の Remove ボタンを押し、Vortexを再起動する
(2) Settingsページを開き、Languageを "日本語(にほんご/にっぽんご)(日本)" に変更する。
(3) 以上で正式版に切り替わり、以降は自動更新されます。


[size=3][color=#f1c232][u][b]このファイルについて[/b][/u][/color][/size]

Vortexの日本語化ファイルです。
Nexus Modsのページにアップロードされた日本語化ファイルは、Nexus Modsのスタッフによって精査された後、Vortexの拡張機能として公開される流れとなっていますので、基本的にVortexの画面からインストールしてください。すでに日本語化拡張機能を導入済みの場合、自動的に更新されますので、特に作業は必要ありません。
なお、本ページの更新から拡張機能としての公開までに数日かかる場合があります。

ご注意:
[list]
[*]現在のバージョンではVortex本体側のローカライズが不完全なため、UI/メッセージの一部が英語のままとなります。
[*]有志によって作成/公開されているVortexの拡張機能は、今のところ日本語化の対象外となります。
[*]ローカライズ対象文字列は専用のツールを開発して出来る限り抽出したつもりですが、まだ漏れがあるかもしれません。
[*]翻訳内容については随時変更/改善していく予定です(提案/指摘歓迎)。
[/list]


[size=3][b][color=#f1c232][u]前提プログラム[/u][/color][/b][/size]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]Vortex[/url] Version 1.3.5以降

※事前リリース版は[url=https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/releases]Nexus ModsのGitHub[/url]からダウンロードできます。


[size=3][color=#f1c232][u][b]インストール方法[/b][/u][/color][/size]

(1) 新規インストールの場合

VortexのSettingsページを開き、InterfaceタブのLanguageから「日本語 (にほんご／にっぽんご)」を選択した後、Vortexを再起動します。
これで日本語化拡張機能がインストールされ、以降は自動アップデートされます。


(2) 日本語化拡張機能をアップデートする場合

Vortexの起動時に更新された拡張機能が自動的にアップデートされます。


(3) 古いバッチ形式の日本語化をインストールしている場合

拡張機能をサポートする前の古い日本語化ファイルを、ファイルコピーまたはバッチコマンドを実行してインストールしている場合、古い日本語化ファイルを削除しないと、日本語化拡張機能をインストールしても正しく適用されません。
VortexのSettingsページから言語をEnglishに戻した後、次のフォルダーを削除してからVortexを再起動してください。
・C:\Users\ユーザー名\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales\ja
・C:\ProgramData\Vortex\locales\ja
※ドライブ名とパスはOS環境/ユーザアカウント名によって異なります。
その後、(1)の方法で新規インストールを行ってください。


[size=3][color=#f1c232][u][b]問題解決のヒント[/b][/u][/color][/size]

[list]
[*]Vortexで"missing .node module"エラーが出る場合、Visual C++のランタイムパッケージのインストールが必要です。こちらのページからvc_redist.x64.exeをインストールしてください（バージョンは明記されていませんが、最新のものでいいはず）→ [url=https://support.microsoft.com/ja-jp/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads]最新のサポートされる Visual C++ のダウンロード（マイクロソフト）[/url]
[*]NMMからのインポート時に「すべてのMODを無効にしてください」エラーとなってインポートできない場合、ゲームフォルダーに残っているプラグインを手動で削除してください。
[/list]


[size=3][color=#f1c232][u][b]訳文の改善について[/b][/u][/color][/size]

0.18.2にて、ルール定義画面や依存関係/警告アイコンのツールチップに表示される文章を改善し、前後関係をわかりやすくしました(ご指摘いただいたmrredpizza氏に感謝)。
誤訳の指摘や改善提案があれば、私の[url=http://thinkingskeever.hatenablog.com/entry/2018/10/21/140000]ブログ記事のコメント[/url]、Nexusのプライベートメッセージ(漢字使用不可、ローマ字で書くこと)、Discordアカウント「[color=#6fa8dc][b]BowmoreLover#6259[/b][/color]」のいずれかまでお願いします。


[size=3][b][color=#f1c232][u]Vortexの日本語ドキュメントについて[/u][/color][/b][/size]

以下のページでVortexのドキュメント/Wikiの和訳を公開中です。

[url=http://thinkingskeever.hatenablog.com/entry/2018/10/15/182000]Vortex紹介ページの和訳 (Thinking Skeever)[/url]

[url=http://thinkingskeever.hatenablog.com/entry/2018/10/17/183000]Nexus Mods: Vortexヘルプセンターの和訳 (Thinking Skeever)[/url]

[url=http://thinkingskeever.hatenablog.com/entry/2018/10/21/140000]Nexus Wiki: Vortexページの和訳 (Thinking Skeever)[/url]

description.short: German translation for Vortex
description.long:
Description / Beschreibung

This file contains the german translation for Vortex which is bundled in Vortex versions before 1.1.0.

Diese Datei enthält die Deutsche Übersetzung für Vortex die vor Version 1.1.0 mitgeliefert wurde.


Installation

No installation necessary. Vortex up to 1.0.x includes this translation, from 1.1.0 forward the language drop-down in Settings->Interface includes third-party languages like this one.

Eine Installation ist nicht nötig. Vortex bis einschließlich 1.0.x wird mit dieser Übersetzung ausgeliefert, ab 1.1.0 werden alle Übersetzungen von Dritten unter Settings->Interface aufgelistet.

Contributing / Unterstützung

This translation was mostly created by "dertrutinator" and me (Tannin) but all contributions are welcome. Also I'd very much welcome someone taking up maintenance of this page.

Diese Übersetzung wurde hauptsächlich von "dertrutinator" und mir (Tannin) erstellt aber alle Beiträge sind herzlich willkommen. Ich würde mich auch freuen wenn jemand die Verwaltung dieser Seite übernimmt.

extensions.author: ffgriever

description.short: This extension adds Final Fantasy XII: The Zodiac Age support to the Vortex mod manager.
description.long:
[center]﻿[/center][center][color=#ea9999][b][size=5]Vortex support for Final Fantasy XII: The Zodiac Age[/size][/b][/color][/center]

Simple as that. Extension adds support for FF12. It's still an early version, but it should work just fine. Extension searches for ff12data directory and auto-installs it. Of course FOMOD installer is supported if you need it.

[b]Big changes in version 0.8.0[/b]
[list]
[*] Added support for FF12 External File Loader, which allows to load unpacked files from folders instead of VBF archive. This means no more patching huge 30GB file and filesize tables.
[*] Added support for FF12 LUA Loader.
[*] Added support for new mod types: modules and LUA scripts.
[*] Added support for old, Vortex incompatible mods with multiple choices/versions. This feature is experimental and might fail in some cases, but all old mods tested so far worked just fine.
[*] Disabled VBF tools auto updates (since new, better method is available, I'm not planning any updates to these; support for VBF patching will be removed from the extension in future versions).
[/list]
[i]All previously installed mods are compatible with the FF12 External File Loader.[/i]

[b]Current features:[/b]
[list]
[*]installation/uninstallation/enabling/disabling/purging
[*]automatic VBF archive patching via external tools (modified specifically to work with Vortex)
[*]automatic FileSizeTable_XX.fst patching for all supported languages
[*]any mod can be uninstalled at any time without breaking anything
[*]conflict resolution via Vortex tools
[/list]
If you want to get back to vanilla game, either disable all mods or simply purge them all (this should save you redownloading 30GB file again).

[s]For advanced users there is a possibility to switch the extension into non-merge mode (installing mods into separate directories, which is faster, but mods can be uninstalled only in reverse order of installation, just as in case of Draklab). In this mode conflict detection doesn't work. [b]Switch only if you know exactly what you're doing[/b].[/s]

[center]﻿[/center][center][color=#ea9999][b][size=5]Vortex support for Final Fantasy XII: The Zodiac Age[/size][/b][/color][/center]

[center]Before installation, make sure that [b]64bit Visual C++ Runtime is installed[/b]. You can download the newest one here:
[url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads]https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads[/url]
or directly here:
[url=https://aka.ms/vs/16/release/vc_redist.x64.exe]https://aka.ms/vs/16/release/vc_redist.x64.exe[/url][/center]

[center]﻿[/center][center][color=#ea9999][b][size=5]Installation[/size][/b][/color][/center]

[size=3][b]Automatic install.[/b][/size]

Since Vortex 1.1.0 the easiest method is just to go to [b]"games"[/b] then select "[b]Final Fantasy XII"[/b] and click [b]"manage"[/b]. This extension will be downloaded automatically. From now on it will also [b]update automatically[/b].

extensions.name: Final Fantasy XII The Zodiac Age Vortex support

description.short: A useful extension for Vortex which allows you to use xEdit's "Quick Auto Clean" function on any GameBryo plugins in your load order.
description.long:
Integrates an automated plugin cleaning function into Vortex for Gamebyro plugins.

[b]This extension requires [url=https://github.com/TES5Edit/TES5Edit/releases]xEdit by ElminsterAU[/url] to be installed on your PC and defined in the dashboard of your chosen game inside Vortex.
[/b]
In v0.0.1 a new button has been added to the info pane for Gamebyro plugins which will launch xEdit and perform a "quick auto clean" operation on the selected plugin.

A future update may allow the user to right-click a plugin to activate the cleaning function from the context menu, however, this is currently not possible.
[list]
[*]The cleaning option will not appear if the plugin is the primary master file (e.g. Skyrim.esm).
[*]The cleaning option will be disabled if either the plugin has missing masters or there is a LOOT message informing the user not to clean it. In the latter case, you are free to clean it manually, this just disables the automation.
[/list]
Once xEdit has closed, Vortex will show a confirmation of the plugin we attempted to clean.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/61/61-1572538680-559194572.png[/img]

Currently supports:
[list]
[*]Skyrim
[*]Skyrim SE
[*]Skyrim VR
[*]Fallout 4
[*]Fallout 4 VR
[*]Fallout New Vegas
[*]Oblivion
[*]Fallout 3
[*]Enderal
[*]Fallout 76
[/list]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/61/61-1573584841-371036160.png[/img]

[b]Vortex Install

[/b][list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install[/b]

Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins.

description.short: Adds support for GTA V
description.long:
[size=4]Description
[/size]
This extension adds support for GTA V to Vortex.
You can use it to install plugins for script hook, asset replacers as well as addons.

Script Hook V and OpenIV are required, the extension will guide you through the correct installation once you start managing the game inside Vortex.

[size=4]How to install
[/size]
This requires Vortex 1.1.0! To install, go to Extensions->Find More. Find this extension and click install.

[size=4]How to install mods[/size]

Please be aware that, since the game has been around for a while, a lot of mods may be packaged in a way that doesn't install correctly out of the box, if a mod doesn't work, please check in the staging folder whether it's been installed correctly.

The extension will try to install all mods automatically but if a mod doesn't work you may want to check if it was installed correctly.

There are effectively three kind of mods: replacers, addons, script hook plugins
Within Vortex these should be assigned a mod type accordingly, replacers will have the "default" mod type, addons will be "gta5dlc", plugins will be "gta5asi". This is the first thing to check, determine which kind of mod you have and whether it has the right mod type.

After that check the staging folder for the mod.
For addons you should find a "dlc.rpf" in the root of the mod folder, for plugins there should be a <something something>.asi file - again at the root.
All other files, stuff like screenshots, don't really matter.

Replacers are a bit more complex, they should have the same directory structure as the game directory, with rpfs being directories.
So if you have a mod with installation instructions like this:
[quote]
﻿1. Go to mods/update/update.rpf/x64/patch/data/cdimages/scaleform_minimap.rpf
﻿2. Click on "Add new file" and import the 'minimap.ytd' file provided by this mod.[/quote]
What you expect is a directory structure like this:
update
|-> update.rpf
﻿|-> x64
﻿ ﻿|-> patch
﻿ ﻿ ﻿|-> data
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|-> cdimages
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|-> scaleform_minimap.rpf
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|-> minimap.ytd

Both "update.rpf" and "scaleform_minimap.rpf" are regular directories here!

If you have a mod that contains different kinds of mods (e.g. a plugin *and* replacers) you have to split them up into multiple mods.

[size=4]How to deploy mods

[/size]Unlike with most games supported by Vortex, deployment for GTA V is a bit more involved. We strongly advice you don't do this after every mod you install but instead only do it once before actually want to start playing the game.

The deployment will work as usual but at the end a dialog will tell you openiv needs to be started. Do the installation and follow the instructions given, there is very little room to actually make a mistake.
The only thing you have to look out for: when asked, select you want to install to the "mods" directory. Do *not* install to the base game directory. If the "mods" option is unavailable for some reason: Cancel, check that you installed openiv.asi, ask for help if necessary. [b]Never [/b]install to the base game directory.

[size=4]Finally[/size]

We do not support using mods in multiplayer. We do not condone using mods in multiplayer.
Your account may be banned for using any mods in public multiplayer and there is nothing we can do about that.

If you do want to switch between modded singleplayer and unmodded multiplayer, do be careful that you deactivate mods before you start multiplayer.
Vortex will help you in two ways
a) When Vortex has modded your game, you should see the word "Modded" and a Vortex icon added to the game icon (in the lower left). If you see this, you still have mods installed. But: If you don't see it, you may still be running mods you installed outside Vortex!
b) Use Vortex to install scripthook. That way when you "Purge" mods within Vortex it will remove script hook from the game, thereby disabling openiv.asi thereby the game won't use the modified files from the "mods" directory and you should be running a vanilla game. If you don't know: "Purge" is not a destructive operation, nothing is irreversibly lost. It just temporarily removes mods from the game. The next time you "deploy" all mods will be restored.

description.short: A Vortex extension that adds support for Source Filmmaker (SFM). This allows for managing SFM mods, assets and scripts using the Vortex mod manager, simplifying management of SFM mods from external sources using Vortex's familiar tools and interface.
description.long:
[code]vortex-sfm[/code] is a Vortex extension that adds support for Source Filmmaker. This allows for managing (non-Workshop) mods and assets using the Vortex mod manager.

This simplifies installing SFM “mods” from external sources (SFMLab, other users, forums, DA etc) by automatically installing any mod from an archive file. It also means you can quickly and easily enable/disable or uninstall mods without affecting your other installed mods, all from Vortex’s convenient UI.

[quote]If you already use Vortex for games, this extension will not interfere with them and SFM will simply be available as a discovered game you can manage.[/quote]
For information on downloads and installing, check out the [url=https://github.com/silveredgold/vortex-sfm]GitHub repo[/url] or the [url=https://vortex-sfm.silveredgold.vip/]full online docs[/url].

description.short: Adds support for PAYDAY 2 to Vortex
description.long:
[size=4]Description
[/size]
This extension adds support for PAYDAY 2 to Vortex.
You can use it to install SuperBLT mods.

SuperBLT is required, the extension will check and give you a download link once you start managing the game inside Vortex.

[size=4]How to install
[/size]
This method requires at least Vortex 1.1.0!
To install, you should be able to find this under your games list, no special steps necessary.

This method works for all versions!
If special steps are necessary:
1. Download the main file of this extension.
2. Enable Advanced mode in Vortex to reveal the Extensions tab.
3. Drop the main file .7z onto the box at the bottom of the Extensions tab.
4. Restart Vortex and you should find PAYDAY 2 support under Games!

[size=4]How to install mods[/size]

90% of PAYDAY2 mods are BLT-style mods, so installation will be drag and drop!
The other 10% are "mod_overrides"-style mods, and are not yet supported. Vortex will inform you it cannot be installed and you will need to install them manually based on what the mod says (for now.) 

[size=4]How to deploy mods

[/size]Deployment should run without a hitch unless BLT's built-in auto-updater has updated a mod.

The deployment will work as usual, but at the end a dialog will tell you files have been changed on disk. Select the option to "Choose newest file" as is default and continue for your mods to update and work as expected.

[size=4]Planned Features
[/size]
1. Support for "mod_overrides"-style mods
2. Get mod metadata from mod.txt, especially for mods from outside sources that don't follow naming conventions.
3. Mod conflict detection? (Overlapping hooks or replacements, based on BLT mod.txt metadata)
3.1. Automatic conflict alerts in Vortex? (Preventing them may be extreme, warnings only?)
4. Crash logs management?
4.1. Detecting which mod caused the most recent crash?
5. Detect multiple mods in an archive and add them individually (and include them as a category?)

[size=4]Known Issues
[/size]
1. Do not start the game via Vortex or you will get a "Game already running" error.
2. "mod_overrides"-style mods are not supported yet, these are commonly reskins or retextures.
3. Since many mods for this game are old and discontinued, expect some to cause crashes. Luckily, Vortex makes disabling mods a breeze. :)

[size=4]Finally[/size]

Some mods for PAYDAY 2 change the damage/balancing of guns or give the player extreme unfair stat advantages. These types of mods are considered cheats by the community and I personally recommend you only use them in offline lobbies.
Note that you will never be banned from the game itself, only from certain users who block cheaters.

description.short: Adds support for Red Dead Redemption 2 to Vortex.
description.long:
[size=4]Description
[/size]
This extension adds support for Red Dead Redemption 2 to Vortex.
You can use it to install plugins for script hook.
Asset mods and addons will be added as soon as the relevant tools (OpenIV) have been updated to support RDR2.

Script Hook RDR2 (by Alexander Blade) is required, the extension will guide you through the correct installation once you start managing the game inside Vortex.

[size=4]How to install
[/size]
This requires Vortex 1.1.0 or newer! To install, go to Extensions->Find More. Find this extension and click install.

[size=4]Finally[/size]

We do not support using mods in multiplayer. We do not condone using mods in multiplayer.
Your account may be banned for using any mods in public multiplayer and there is nothing we can do about that.

If you do want to switch between modded singleplayer and unmodded multiplayer, do be careful that you deactivate mods before you start multiplayer.
Vortex will help you in two ways
a) When Vortex has modded your game, you should see the word "Modded" and a Vortex icon added to the game icon (in the lower left). If you see this, you still have mods installed. But: If you don't see it, you may still be running mods you installed outside Vortex!
b) Use Vortex to install scripthook. That way when you "Purge" mods within Vortex it will remove script hook from the game and in turn all scripts that depend on it.

description.short: This is a very simple extension that takes the list of mods that Vortex currently has and writes them to a file. It then allows you to take that file and Restore your list of mods, making Vortex download them again as if you'd downloaded them from the Nexus Website.
description.long:
[b]How do I use this?[/b]
Go to your mods tab and you should see a "Modlist" button in the top menu. If you click on that, you'll see three options: "Modlist Backup: Restore", "Modlist Backup All Games" and "Modlist Backup Only This Game". To back up your mods, click either the "Modlist Backup All Games" or "Modlist backup Only This Game". This will open up a save file window that asks you to open a file, but instead of opening an existing file you want to save to one that doesn't exist yet. Do this by going to the bottom bar where there's a text box for "File name:" and enter a new name. This should be the name of a file that doesn't already exist, and it's where your mod list will be saved. For example, type in "Modlist.txt" or "Mods.json". Then click open. A popup should then ask you if you want to create this file, select yes.

To restore, select "Modlist Backup: Restore", navigate to that file that you saved previously and open it. It will only restore the mods for the currently active game, even if the modlist you created has multiple games in it

[b]Important Note
[/b]A recent version of Vortex fixes a bug that in turn stopped this mod from being able to Restore modlists. If you're unable to restore your modlist, please update this mod to Version 0.3.0 or newer and try again

[b]What does this do?[/b]
This is a very simple extension that takes the list of mods that Vortex currently has and writes them to a file. It then allows you to take that file and Restore your list of mods, making Vortex download them again as if you'd downloaded them from the Nexus Website.

[b]Does this backup Mod Configs, Load Order, Dependencies Etc.
[/b]No, this is a simple and rather dumb extension that [i]just[/i] backs up the list of mods

[b]Does it back up the mod files
[/b]No, this only stores list of mods. When you Restore the list, Vortex will download every mod on the list

[b]Are there any requirements
[/b]You need to be a premium member on the Nexus site to Restore the list, since the Vortex client won't let you download the mods automatically unless you're a premium member, since you need to see the ads.

description.short: This extension adds support for Outer Wilds to Vortex.
description.long:
[size=4]Installation[/size]

[list=1]
[*]Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/outerwilds/mods/1]Outer Wilds Mod Loader (OWML)[/url].
[*]In Vortex, go to Extensions and click Find more.
[*]Find "Outer Wilds Support" and Install it.
[/list]

description.short: Clean and modern theme for Vortex with usability improvements
description.long:
[b]VortexNeue [/b]is a clean and modern theme designed for Vortex. Additionally, it includes some usability improvements that makes Vortex more user-friendly.

All the settings on the theme tabs are customizable in this theme.
It is also compatible with color scheme from other themes on Nexus, simply replace the [code]variables.scss[/code] in VortexNeue with the one from the other theme.

Here's a list of theme that works well with VortexNeue:
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/27]Nexus Mods Site Themes for Vortex[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/79]Voidem[/url]﻿
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/113]VortexCovid[/url]﻿
[/list]
Please feel free to leave suggestions or feedbacks on the comment section!


[b][size=4]Installation[/size][/b]

[b]Vortex Install (Easy)[/b]

[list=1]
[*]In Vortex, press the Find more button at the bottom in the Extension tab.
[*]Type [code]vortexneue[/code] in the search box and press enter.
[*]Click the install button.
[*]Open Vortex and navigate to Settings -> Themes and select [code]vortexneue[/code].
[*]Check the Dark Theme toggle
[*]Adjust the font-size to 12 (optional)
[*]Set dashlets to fit-content (optional)
[*]Adjust the color to your liking (optional)
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)[/b]

[list=1]
[*]Close Vortex before installing.
[*]Open the skin directory of Vortex: [code]%APPDATA%\Vortex\Themes[/code]. [i]Note: If you used Shared mode under Settings -> Vortex your themes folder will be [code]C:\ProgramData\vortex\themes[/code][/i]
[*]Extract the .zip into this directory.
[*]Open Vortex and navigate to Settings -> Themes and select [code]vortexneue[/code].
[*]Check the Dark Theme toggle
[*]Adjust the font-size to 12 (optional)
[*]Set dashlets to fit-content (optional)
[*]Adjust the color to your liking (optional)
[/list]

description.short: Extension that adds unofficial support for S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Call of Chernobyl to Vortex.
description.long:
[b][font=Verdana]Description[/font]

[/b][font=Comic Sans MS]This extension will add [i][b]"S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Call of Chernobyl"[/b][/i] to list of games supported by [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i]. There is no difference what version you using. Be that version latest [b][i]"1.5 R6"[/i][/b] or [i][b]"1.4.22"[/b][/i] or any other, doesn't matter. [/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]
[/font][font=Verdana][b][center][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ff7700]Also, be sure to have full folder structure in [font=Georgia]"gamedata/configs"[/font], as game/mod always checks entire folder for files. Even if it any not game/mod related file. As Vortex, will create [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex" file[/font] in folder it creates, you will have infinity loading bug. As i'm mentioned above, game/mod will try to read any file that located in [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] folder include [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex"[/font] file. (This happens only with [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] folder) I will also add fix for this, if you can't do this manually![/color][/font][/center][/b][/font]
[font=Verdana][b]How to install[/b][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Require [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] for this extension to work. There is 2 ways to install.
1. In [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] go to [b]"Extensions"[/b], click [b]"Find more"[/b] button, search for this extension.
2. Download manually from site and extract to [b]"C:/UserName/AppData/Roaming/Vortex/plugins"[/b]. Also you need "[b]Show hidden files and folders[/b]" set to on, before install this extension this way.
[b]
[font=Verdana]How this works

[/font][/b]Similar as [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] supported mods, just add archive of any mod, then install it. Also, first folder in archive must be [b]"gamedata"[/b]([b]"database"[/b] for some mods) not [b]"FolderName/gamedata"[/b][/font].

[b]Additional[/b]

[i][b][i][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/78]"[i][b][i][b]S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl"[/b][/i][/b][/i][/url][/b][/i] ,[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/185] "[i][b]S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky"[/b][/i][/url]  [/b][/i]and[i][b]  [i][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/186][b]"S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: [/b][b]Call of Pripyat"[/b][/url]﻿[/i][/b][/i] have it own [i][b]"Vortex" [/b][/i]extension.

description.short: A Vortex extension for Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order featuring mod management and load order support.
description.long:
This extension adds Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order as a game supported in Vortex. Current the extension only supports PAK files, installing a non-PAK mod will result in a warning appearing. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]
[b]
Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins.

description.short: A basic recolor theme based on the default compact option. It's easy on the eyes, and not too dull due to purple being a great color in general.
description.long:
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=3]Voidem, short for void theme. It sounds cool. It looks cool. It feels good, too. And that's about it. Not sure what wall of text I can type in here about a basic recolor, but I'll spare you all, and leave you to navigate to the download section so you can get this, apply it, and have your peace of mind.[/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=3]
To install it simply drop the folder found in RAR file in your Vortex themes folder. By default this path is in [b][u]C:\Users\YourUsername\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\themes[/u][/b].

Now launch Vortex, and go to the themes tab under settings and select "Voidem". New looks should be applied. If not, apply the built in Vortex "compact" theme, then reapply "Voidem" afterwards.

If you don't want to go through with this, you can check the image section and click on the image called "Settings" which will have all settings for you to copy manually if you wish so.[/size]

description.short: WIP Extension for vortex to enable support for Fable Anniversary
description.long:
Unzip "game-fableanniversary" into "C:\Users\xonem\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins" when your done there should be a folder called "game-fableanniversary" in the plugins folder and inside "game-fableanniversary" should be the files from the zip

WIP Extension for vortex to enable support for Fable Anniversary

Because of the wide assortment of mod file locations for fable anniversary you'll need to package your mods like so

Mod tool install locations:
"Binaries\Win32"

Cosmetic Changes:
"WellingtonGame\Content\*"

World Edit + Cosmetic World Edits:
"WellingtonGame\Content\Maps\*"
"WellingtonGame\FableData\Build\Data\Levels"

Some mods will be in other folders surrounding these so please start your zip by packaging the sub folder inside of fable anniversary

description.short:
Quite simply, it adds a "Browse" section containing an embedded Nexus Mods browser.
This allows you to browse and download mods from inside Vortex itself.
description.long:
Quite simply, it adds a "Browse" section containing an embedded Nexus Mods browser.
This allows you to browse and download mods from inside Vortex itself.

[b]Current features:[/b]
[list]
[*]Back, forward and refresh buttons.
[*]Visible url, mainly for copying mod-links etc.
[*]Downloads mods in Vortex, just like your normal browser.
[/list]Note: You may have to initially login to Nexus Mods inside Vortex, but it should remember your session as normal after that.
More features may be added later, as I see fit.

[b]Installation:[/b]
(Thank you [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/1265]Zanderat[/url])
First, enable "Advanced Mode" in the Vortex settings, and drag-and-drop the archive as shown below.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/88/88-1587382716-1145834175.jpeg[/img]

This extension is Open Source under GPL-3.0. The code is available at [url=https://github.com/MaverickMartyn/builtin-mod-browser]https://github.com/MaverickMartyn/builtin-mod-browser[/url].

description.short: Adds support for World of Warcraft and World of Warcraft Classic to Vortex.
description.long:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/oTMyfWZ.png[/img]


[size=4][b]Current features:[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]Supports World of Warcraft and World of Warcraft Classic as separate games.
[*]Curseforge can be opened inside Vortex at the bottom of the mods table.
[*]Compatible with all CurseForge Addons that include a TOC file and are structured as expected.
[/list]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/niLOo3E.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/sg46PdR.png[/img]


[size=4][b]Current issues:[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]Detection of WoW and WoW Classic are based on guesswork for registry keys. At least one of the two detections will not work properly.
[*]The installer function currently produces an error, so it is commented out.
[*]No support for mods that are not AddOns.
[/list]

[size=4][b]Possible Enhancements:[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]Pull addon meta-information about mod from CurseForge or the TOC file (this could be confusing if there are several TOC files though).
[*]A "load order" tab allowing you to toggle addons on/off per character but editing the AddOns.txt found at [code]E:\World of Warcraft\_classic_\WTF\Account\<account_name>\<realm_name>\<character_name>\AddOns.txt.[/code]
[*]The limits are your imagination.
[/list]
Please feel free to clone this repo or create a PR if you'd like to improve it.


[size=4][b]How to install[/b][/size]
Download the contents of this repo and copy the files to %AppData%/Vortex/Plugins/game-worldofwarcraft (you will need to create the folders).

description.short: Traduction Française pour Vortex | French Translation
description.long:
[center][img]https://forums.nexusmods.com/flags/fr.gif[/img] [size=3]Translation [FR] / Traduction française de[/size]
[size=5][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/48/48-1585009525-1473542554.png[/img][/url][/size]
par [b]Nexus Mods[/b][/center]
[color=#FFA53F]
[/color][color=#ffd966]== DESCRIPTION
=================================[/color]
VORTEX est un gestionnaire  de mod, il succède et remplace Nexus Mod Manager (NMM).

[color=#b6b6b6]Notez Bien : 
* Cette version contient les dernières traductions française à jour (en collaboration avec Ozzydarkfmw)
[s]* Plusieurs éléments de Vortex contiennent des valeurs en dur, la traduction ne s'applique donc pas partout (pas encore)[/s][/color]

   
[color=#ffd966]== INSTALLATION
=================================[/color]

[color=#FFA53F]A) Déployer automatiquement avec Vortex [color=#B45F06][i](compatible v1.2+)[/i][/color][/color]
Dans le menu [color=#6d9eeb]SETTINGS[/color], onglet [color=#6d9eeb]INTERFACE[/color], ouvrir la liste déroulante et sélectionner : [[color=#6d9eeb]  français, langue française (Extension by Ozzydarkfmw - Aogara)  [/color]][color=#e06666]
[/color]
[color=#FFA53F]B) Déployer manuellement avec Vortex [color=#B45F06][i](compatible v1.1+)[/i][/color][/color]
1) Activer le mode avancé
    ouvrir Vortex et se rendre dans le menu  [color=#6d9eeb]SETTINGS[/color] (PARAMÈTRES)  situé à gauche, puis activer l'option  [color=#6d9eeb]Enable Advanced Mode[/color].
    Cela va vous afficher le menu  [color=#6d9eeb]EXTENSIONS[/color]  sur la gauche.

2) Déployer le dictionnaire
     Télécharger la traduction (pas besoin d'extraire le contenu de l'archive zip,7z)
     ouvrir Vortex et se rendre dans le menu  [color=#6d9eeb]EXTENSIONS[/color]  situé à gauche,
     prendre l'archive et la glisser dans la zone  [color=#6d9eeb]Drop File(s)[/color]  tout en bas à droite, un message en jaune apparaît tout en haut, cliquer sur  [color=#6d9eeb]Restart[/color].

3) Activer la traduction
    Une fois Vortex redémarré, se rendre dans le menu [color=#6d9eeb]SETTINGS[/color] (PARAMÈTRES) situé à gauche,
    dans l'onglet  [color=#6d9eeb]INTERFACE [/color], ouvrir la liste déroulante et sélectionner : [[color=#6d9eeb]  français, langue française (France)  [/color]]

[color=#93c47d]Lorsqu'une nouvelle version du dictionnaire sera disponible, Vortex déclenchera automatiquement sa mise à jour en arrière plan et vous invitera à redémarrer pour appliquer les changements.[/color]
[color=#e06666]
[/color][color=#e06666][b]IMPORTANT :
Quelle que soit la méthode choisie, après tout changement de langue ou mise à jour de dictionnaire, un redémarrage de Vortex est nécessaire.
Sans cela, des parties de l'interface peuvent rester affichées avec les libellés du dictionnaire précédent. Le redémarrage force la propagation à toute l'application.[/b]
[/color]

[color=#ffd966]== DÉSINSTALLATION / NETTOYAGE
=================================[/color]

[color=#FFA53F]A) Si vous aviez installé des dictionnaires avec Vortex :[/color]
Se rendre dans le menu "EXTENSIONS", et supprimer tous les dictionnaires [color=#e69138]"<langue> translation for Vortex"[/color] devenus inutiles.

[color=#FFA53F]B) Si vous aviez installé des dictionnaires avec une autre méthode :[/color]
Se rendre dans [color=#b6b6b6]%APPDATA%\[/color][color=#ffd966]Vortex\locales[/color] et supprimer touts les répertoires de langue devenus inutiles.
[color=#e06666][b]S'il y a un répertoire fr\[/b] : supprimez le, il est devenu inutile et empêche le déploiement des dictionnaires déployés par Vortex.[/color]

[color=#b6b6b6]Valeurs connues de [b]%APPDATA%\Vortex[/b]  pour Windows :
    C:\Utilisateurs\<VotreNom>\AppData\Roaming\Vortex
    C:\Users\<VotreNom>\AppData\Roaming\Vortex
    C:\ProgramData[/color][color=#b6b6b6]\Vortex
[/color]

[color=#ffd966]== RECOMMANDATIONS
=================================[/color]
* Le thème [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/97]Subtle[/url]﻿  (que vous pouvez déployer depuis le menu extensions de Vortex)


[color=#ffd966]== OUTILS UTILISÉS
=================================[/color]
* Gestion des dictionnaires : [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/33]Unofficial Vortex Translation Tool[/url] + [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/28]Translation Helper[/url]
* Traduction : [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/134]xTranslator[/url]
* [url=http://winmerge.org/?lang=fr]WinMerge
[/url]

[color=#ffd966]== CRÉDITS / SHOUTOUT
=================================[/color]
* Nexus Mods et Black Tree Gaming Ltd  pour Vortex
* Ozzydarkfmw pour son travail depuis les premières heures de Vortex
* Tous les moddeurs qui produisent/maintiennent les outils mentionnés ci-dessus

description.short: Enables Phoenix Point support for Vortex.
description.long:
# Phoenix Point Vortex Extension

This repository houses a basic extension for the [Vortex mod manager](https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/) which allows for management of mods via Vortex.

## What does this extension do?

* Allow for management of Phoenix Point mods within Vortex.
* Ensures the existence of the `Mods` folder which all current mod loaders adhere to.

## What **doesn't** this extension do?

* Install PPML or Modnix. It is assumed you already have one of these installed.

## To-Do

- [ ] Automated install of supported mod loaders. (Modnix, PPML)
- [ ] Get approved by Nexus as a proper game extension. (Enables direct installs from the nexus mods website.)

description.short: Adds support for installing and managing Beat Saber mods with Vortex
description.long:
BeatVortex adds support for installing and managing Beat Saber mods through Vortex. You can use Vortex to install mods alongside Mod Assistant or any other Beat Saber modding tools.

Find full documentation on using Vortex with Beat Saber at [url=https://beatvortex.dev]beatvortex.dev[/url]

[size=5]Installation[/size]

You should be able to automatically install the extension by clicking Manage on Beat Saber in the Games list, just like your other Vortex games. If that doesn't work, you can install the extension directly using the Find More button at the bottom of the Extensions screen: just find Beat Saber Support and Install it.

[size=5]Adding Beat Saber[/size]

Once the extension is installed, Vortex should automatically discover Beat Saber in the "Discovered" tab of the Games screen. Click Manage to perform initial setup and add Beat Saber to your games list.

[size=5]Installing Mods[/size]

Just like any other Vortex game, installing mods from archives is pretty simple: download the zip file, drag-and-drop into Vortex, then Install and Enable the mod.

[size=5]BeatMods[/size]

Since v0.2.0, you can quickly browse and install mods from BeatMods without leaving Vortex. Open the new BeatMods page from the left sidebar to see all the currently available mods for your game version.

[size=5]OneClick[/size]

Since v0.2.0, you can enable our preview support for OneClick installs from your Vortex settings. Open the Download tab in Settings, scroll down to "Enable OneClick Installations" and you can individually enable OneClick link handling for maps, models or playlists. You can then use the OneClick links on BeatSaver, BeastSaber and ModelSaber to install mods with Vortex. See [url=https://beatvortex.dev/docs/usage/mods/]beatvortex.dev[/url] for more information on OneClick installation.

description.short: Polish translation for Vortex mod manager.
description.long:
[size=4]About
[/size]
This mod is a WIP Polish translation for Vortex mod manager made with Unofficial Vortex Translation Tool. It is not finished yet but probably won't cover every string in the application as Vortex code is a very big pile of crap that has many lines hardcoded in it.

[size=4]Installation

[/size]Download the archive, unzip it in any folder and run the .cmd file to place the JSON files inside the Vortex folder. Then open your Vortex, go to Settings -> Interface and change language to [i]polski[/i]. No need to restart the app. [b]If lacking of polish letters in headings bothers you, go to[i] Settings -> Theme -> Clone[/i] your theme and change [i]headings font family[/i] to e.g. Roboto Black. For Polish language it'll be [i]Ustawienia -> Motyw -> Klonuj[/i] and "[i]krój czcionki (nagłówki)[/i]".[/b]

[size=4]Uninstallation

[/size]Just delete all the [i]pl[/i] folders (with everything that's inside of them) in localization folders of your Vortex directory.

description.short: This extension adds support for Fell Seal: Arbiter's Mark mods to the Vortex mod manager.
description.long:
> This extension is still in preview, please report any issue syou find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Fell Seal: Arbiter's Mark mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.

Using Vortex, you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Fell Seal just like you install mod archives for any of the other Vortex-supported games.

[size=4]A word of warning[/size]

Because of how Fell Seal mods work, you will almost certainly hit incompatibilities! Vortex will warn you when mods try to overwrite each other, such as edits to `Encounters.txt` or `Jobs.xml`, but you should be aware that these errors are very likely to get in your way.

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension either from the CI builds (click the Actions tab above), or by installing it directly from Vortex's Extensions pane. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

[quote]Most of the installation steps shown will require Advanced Mode to be enabled in Vortex! Enable it in the Settings window, under Interface > Advanced > Enable Advanced Mode.[/quote]

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.

description.short: A Vortex extension for Star Wars: Battlefront II (2017) featuring mod management.
description.long:
Adds support for managing Star Wars: Battlefront II (2017) mod files in Vortex.
You will need [url=https://frostytoolsuite.com/downloads.html]Frosty Mod Manager[/url]﻿ to load the mods into the game.

[b][size=4]Installation[/size]
[/b]
[b]Installing Frosty Mod Manager
[/b]
[list=1]
[*][url=https://frostytoolsuite.com/downloads.html]Download[/url]﻿ Frosty Mod Manager from the website.
[*]Create a new folder called [code]FrostyModManager[/code] in the root of your game directory (aka [code]STAR WARS Battlefront II[/code] folder).
[*]Extract the content of the zip archive ([code]FrostyModManager....zip[/code]) you downloaded into the folder.
[/list]
[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list=1]
[*]In Vortex, locate Star Wars: Battlefront II (2017) in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]
[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list=1]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the zip archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[size=4][b]Future plans
[/b][/size]
I am new to both Vortex and Battlefront II modding so feel free to give suggestions or improve upon the extension!
You can also submit patches on the [url=https://github.com/alistair3149/game-starwarsbattlefront22017]Github page[/url]!

[list]
[*]Auto install Frosty Mod Manager or at least auto configure it
[*]Integrate load order support from Frosty to Vortex
[*]Integrate profile support from Frosty to Vortex
[/list]

description.short: Import mods installed via Steam Workshop into Vortex
description.long:
This extension is currently in beta and may include bugs. Please report any problems you encounter. I have only tested this with Steam Workshop for Skyrim 2011. 

You can select which mods to import, then you will be prompted to unsubscribe from the workshop versions before the process completes. Vortex will offer you handy buttons to open each workshop page. If for some reason Steam falls out of whack and doesn't uninstall the mods properly you will need to manually delete the files from your workshop folder. 

Once mods have been import to Vortex they will no longer be updated when the Steam Workshop entry updates. You also cannot reinstall the mods as no archive is created (possible improvement).

I've gone all in with games, just to see how robust it is. Remember, this is very much a beta extension. Currently supports importing from:
[code]﻿['skyrim', 'ahatintime', 'enderal', 'darkestdungeon', 'dawnofman', 'divinityoriginalsin2', 'divinityoriginalsin2definitiveedition', 'faleanniversary', 'galacticcivilisations3', 'kenshi', 'kerbalspaceprogram', 'legendofgrimrock', 'mbwarband', 'neverwinternightsenhancededition', 'oxygennotincluded', 'payday2', 'pillarsofeternity2deadfire', 'portal2', 'prisonarchitect', 'rimworld', 'x4foundations', 'xcom2' ];
[/code]

[b]Vortex Install
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\steam-import

description.short: Import mods installed via Bethesda.net into Vortex.
description.long:
Are there some mods on Bethesda.net you wish you could manage using Vortex? Well now you can!

[b]Features[/b]
[list]
[*]Install any mod downloaded from Bethesda.net into Vortex.
[*]Get mod metadata from the Bethesda.net mod database (internet connection required).
[*]Automatically unsubscribe from Bethesda.net when you import the mod. 
[*]Create an archive backup of the mod so you can reinstall it without going back into the game. 
[*]Optionally, import Creation Club content as a mod.
[/list]
Note: After importing your mods they will no longer be managed by Bethesda.net and cannot be updated.

[b]Vortex Install
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\bethesda-import

description.short: This extension adds support for Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown mods to the Vortex mod manager.
description.long:
> This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.

Using Vortex, you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Ace Combat just like you install mod archives for any of the other Vortex-supported games.

[size=4]A word of warning[/size]

Because of how AC7 mods work, you will almost certainly hit incompatibilities! With the latest versions of the extension, Vortex will warn you when mods seem to be changing the same skin slot, or model, but this isn't perfect and will sometimes miss conflicting mods. You can easily enable/disable conflicting mods though!

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension either from the CI builds on GitHub, or by installing it directly from Vortex's Extensions pane. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.

[size=5][b]How to Install[/b][/size]

[list=1]
[*][size=3]Download the latest archive from the downloads page.[/size]

[/list]
[size=5][b]Potential Improvements[/b][/size]

[size=3]I'm not a programmer, so this extension is rough around the edges and missing many ideal features. 

[list]

[*][size=3]Providing built-in support for installing Pathfinder.[/size]

description.short: This theme is a recolor based on the Contrast Theme. It contains both large and small font sizes in a lovely purple, using dark mode for ease of view.
description.long:
Purple is The Color of Happiness, so we might as well have a bit of it here as well. I based it on the High Contrast theme on Dark Mode to make it easy on the eyes and for the sake of color balance and flow.. I made the larger edition for larger monitors (32" x 1080p and above) and for those of us with older eyes.


[size=6]Included Themes[/size]


[color=#f1f1f1]Perfect Purple Contrast - Small : Uses 12pt Font Size
[/color]Perfect Purple Contrast - Large : Uses 16pt Font Size


[size=6]Installation[/size]


1. Close Vortex before installing.

2. Open "This PC" and navigate to the following path> "C:\Users\{Your Username Here}\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\Themes".

[b][Note 1: If you use Shared mode under "Settings> Vortex" your themes folder will be under  "C:\ProgramData\vortex\themes"][/b]

[b][Note 2: You may also go tot he folder more directly by pressing the Windows Key on the keyboard and tapping R once - Win+R[/b]
[b]  Paste the following in the run box.[/b]

[color=#00ff00]%appdata%[/color]

[b]Press OK or hit Enter and then navigate to the above path][/b]

3. Copy the folders of the theme into this directory.

4. Close This PC

[color=#f1f1f1]5. Open Vortex and navigate to Settings> Themes and select the version you want to use from the Theme drop box.

[/color]Enjoy...


[size=6]Uninstallation[/size]


[color=#f1f1f1]1. Make sure to go to "Settings> Theme" Change to any other theme before making removing.
     [b][Note: You may also use the "Remove" button from within Vortex]

[/b]     [b][Continue with Step 2 if you want to do it manually][/b]

[/color]2. Close Vortex.

3. Reopen the themes folder in AppData or Program Data depending on your setup.

4. Delete the folders of the themes you no longer want.

5. Reopen Vortex and gain satisfaction of a job completed.

description.short: Adds support for installing and managing Command and Conquer Remastered Collection mods with Vortex.
description.long:
> This extension is still in [b]very early preview[/b], please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Command & Conquer Remastered Collection mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.

Using Vortex, you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for C&C Remastered just like you install mod archives for any of the other Vortex-supported games.

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension either from the CI builds on GitHub, or by installing it directly from Vortex's Extensions pane. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

You can then install mods from the Mods screen and Vortex should handle the rest. The extension will try and auto-detect which game the mod is for, but you can override this using the "Mod Type" dropdown from the mod details panel. Mods are automatically installed into their own folder under `~/Documents/CnCRemastered/Mods/<game>`. Remember that you still have to [b]enable mods in-game[/b] from the Options menu before they will take effect.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.

[size=4]A word of warning
[/size]
The extension can't merge INI tweak mods together, so if you install multiple [code]rules.ini[/code] tweaks, you will need to choose which one takes precedence over the others. You can easily enable/disable conflicting mods though!

description.short: This game extension will put mod files with file extension "txt" in the Binaries folder.  Unfortunately, mod designers do not always use the "txt" extension for their mod files.
description.long:
This game extension will put mod files with file extension "txt" in the Binaries folder.  Unfortunately, mod designers do not always use the "txt" extension for their mod files.  For mods that do not have the "txt" file extension, there will usually be a readme file included with the mod that will tell you how to install the mod.
This game extension was tested with the Epic Games version of the game, but should also work with the Steam version of the game.

This game extension will allow you to start the game inside of Vortex; however, the Epic Games version of the game requires you to first start the Epic Games Launcher.  I did not add the Epic Games Launcher to the extension so that it will be more compatible with the Steam version, which does not require a separate launcher.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension so far.

---
