description.short: Easily build and upload your modlists to Modwatch directly from Vortex. Powered by Vortex Showcase.
description.long:
[quote]Find the full documentation at [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support]modwatch.vortex.support[/url]﻿[/quote]
This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple extension that adds support for building and uploading modlists based on your installed mods directly to Modwatch from Vortex. You can easily create and upload modlists for any supported game directly from the Vortex mods page without any external uploader.

There's plenty more information on what is and isn't available in [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support/]the docs[/url], especially [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support/docs/introduction/faq]the FAQ[/url].

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension directly from Vortex's Extensions pane, or from the CI builds on GitHub. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go. If you don't have Showcase installed, Vortex will prompt you to install it.

You can then create and upload mod lists based on your enabled mods (from the top bar) of the mods page. You can also use the normal "Create Showcase" buttons to create a modlist for only a selection of mods (check [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support/docs/usage/]the docs [/url]for more details).

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension so far.

---

[i]Disclaimer[/i]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods, nor with Modwatch.

description.short: Vortex extensions for file previews using WinMerge (and similar diff tools.)
description.long:
[b][size=3]Description[/size][/b]

With this extension installed, when you click "Preview" on a file conflict, it will open the two files in WinMerge to give you a direct comparison between the two.
WinMerge ([url=https://winmerge.org/]https://winmerge.org/[/url]) has to be installed (duh!).
If WinMerge is installed in a non-default location you have to set the correct path in Settings->Tools.
You can also use other visual diff tools as long as they support the same command line parameters (listing the files to compare as the only parameters), Beyond Compare ([url=https://scootersoftware.com/]https://scootersoftware.com/[/url]) works great as well.

[b][size=3]Installation[/size][/b]

This extension requires Vortex >1.2.13. You can install it by going to Extensions->Find more and there look for "Preview WinMerge"

description.short: A generic installer for Unreal Engine games. Configurable using the details pane of your game extension.
description.long:
A generic installer for Unreal Engine games. Configurable using the details pane of your game extension.

[size=4]For users
[/size]This extension will be a requirement for certain other game extensions that utilise it. Vortex will automatically install this extension as required.

[size=4]For developers
[/size]If you're looking into creating a Vortex extension for a game which uses Unreal Engine 4, this extension may cut down on the workload required to get everything working. 

Unreal Engine games [i]generally[/i] follow a simple modding pattern. PAK files can be placed in a ~mods or ~mod folder (usually located at {root}\{gamename}\Content\Paks) and be loaded in alphabetical order. Subfolders within these directories are also loaded alphabetically. 

[b]What this extension does:
[/b][list]
[*]Adds two Mod Types, one for standard UE4 mods and another for UE4 mods including Load Order support. 
[*]Adds a general installer which will detect the mods by the PAK files (or another extension you provide) and assign them the appropriate mod type.
[*]If a mod archive is installed with more than one PAK file, Vortex will show a dialogue where the user can choose which of the PAKs to install. 
[/list]
[b]How to use it: [/b][list]
[*]Add this line to your extension's main function to tell Vortex you need this library installed 'context.requireExtension('Unreal Engine Game Library');'
[*]Inside your game object used in context.registerGame(), make sure to include a 'compatible' property. Inside the object passed there, you need to add 'unrealEngine: true', this tells the extension that you wish to use this library, 
[*]You also need to add an unrealEngine key to the 'details' section including the following values:
[list]
[*]modsPath - the path to install mods, relative to the install folder of the game. e.g. /Soulcaliburvi/Content/Paks/~mods
[*]absModsPath - Optional, if the mods folder isn't inside the game install folder, you can define it here. Use only modsPath OR adsModsPath. 
[*]fileExt - Optional, if you want to check for something other than a PAK file.
[*]loadOrder - Optional, if true this implies you plan to include a Load Order page. Setting this to true without a load order page will have a minor performance impact. 
[/list][/list]

[url=https://github.com/Pickysaurus/vortex-unreal-engine-library/tree/basic-version/example/game-example]You can view a template extension here, which should only require you to change the variables at the top of the index.js file and add some appropriate game artwork.[/url]

description.short: Adds mod management and load order support for Soul Calibur VI to Vortex
description.long:
This extension adds Soul Calibur VI as a game supported in Vortex, for mod management and load ordering. This extension is an example for use of the "Unreal Engine Installer" library which simplifies creating game extensions for UE4 games. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Soul Calibur VI in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[*]If prompted to install "Unreal Engine Installer" click "Fix" and restart Vortex again. 
[/list]
[b]
Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[*]If prompted to install "Unreal Engine Installer" click "Fix" and restart Vortex again. 
[/list]
[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\soulcalibur6.

description.short: Vortex extension to simplify adding new games to Vortex.
description.long:
[b][size=3]Description[/size][/b]

This extension adds a button to the "Games" page that starts a wizard to add games that aren't currently supported by Vortex.
Please note that while you can add any game to Vortex this way, only games that are trivial to mod (as in: modded files get dumped into a specific game directory) will actually work correctly.
For anything more complex programming will be necessary but the code generated by this extension can still serve as a starting point.

You are welcome to release the game extensions you generate with this wizard, the generated code is free of any license restrictions.

[b][size=3]Installation[/size]
[/b]
This extension requires Vortex >1.3.0. You can install it by going to Extensions->Find more and there look for "Add Game Wizard"

description.short: Record a video of the Vortex window with the press of a hotkey.
description.long:
[size=3][b]Description[/b][/size]

With this extension installed you can press ctrl+r to start recording a video of the Vortex window, pressing ctrl+r again will stop the recording and save the video to file.

This is intended to help create tutorials or create a recording of a problem you encounter.

Please note that this extension isn't particularly smart, it will not automatically stop recording before running out of memory or anything, if you forget to stop the recording it may continue eating memory until you run out.

Further note: The recording quality is set fairly low so that files don't get too big. If this is a problem for you, please let me know.

[size=3][b]Installation
[/b][/size]
Go to Extensions->Find more and look for "Screen Recorder".

description.short: Adds support for Control to Vortex.
description.long:
Adds support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/control]Control[/url] to Vortex.

Supports automatic detection of nested mod folders.

If any of the following mod folders are present: [code]data_pc[/code], [code]data[/code] or [code]plugins[/code], they will automatically be recognized as the archive root and be installed into their corresponding folders in the game's installation directory.

If none of these folders are present (e.g. raw DLL mod), then the original archive root will be used as the root directory and contents of the mod will simply be copied into the game's installation directory as-is.

description.short: Por fin,!! después de varios años (desde 2018) teniendo una traducción que no abarca ni el 20% de este estupendo administrador, vengo yo y me sumerjo en esta LOCURA de traducción para todas las personas de habla hispana sin conocimientos de ingles, pereza, o simplemente por que quieren tener el programa en español. Ya era Hora!!
description.long:
[center][/center][center][b]﻿This is a translation from Vortex to Spanish, but if your native language is another one and you want, this is also for you, thank you for visiting this site where everyone is welcome.[/b]


[size=6][b][u]INTRODUCCIÓN

[/u][/b][/size][color=#e69138]Hola a todos y bienvenidos a esta página donde encontraréis la traducción al Español para [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿ compatible con su última versión 1.3.22[/color]
[color=#e69138]Tengo que decir que no ha sido nada fácil para mi, ya que no es una traducción normal como la de un mod común a los que ya después de varios años traduciendo estoy habituado con las aplicaciones apropiadas como [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/134][/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/134]xTranslator[/url]﻿, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/921]ESP-ESM Translator[/url]﻿, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37981]SSEEdit[/url]﻿ [color=#e69138]entre otros.
[/color][color=#e69138]Espero que valoren mi trabajo y me ayuden con críticas constructivas a corregir aquellos errores que haya podido cometer, ya que es mucho texto envuelto en programación para .Json, y por mucho que revise después de tener los ojos cansados me habré saltado algo seguro metiendo la pata.
[/color][color=#f6b26b]Creo que somos muchos los que utilizamos esta estupenda herramienta y nos merecemos tenerla en nuestro idioma, así creo que a muchos le ahorraré no tener que estar investigando ese error que dio [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿ y no tenemos idea de que dice ni por que lo dice. También ayudará a comprender mejor el funcionamiento del programa y que nadie se vuelva loco buscando videos por las redes sociales para ver como se hace cualquier cosa dentro de este magnifico administrador sin romper nuestro juego.
Espero sinceramente ayudar a la gente de esta comunidad, que aunque sinceramente pocos aprecian el trabajo de los creadores de mods, programas y traducciones merece la pena ayudar a la gente dentro de nuestras posibilidades.
Este tiempo lo he dedicado libremente, por lo que nadie me ha pagado absolutamente nada. Nadie me ha contratado, no tengo ningún privilegio dentro de Nexus [/color][color=#ffe599]([/color][color=#f6b26b]ni siquiera tengo la cuenta premium[/color][color=#ffd966])[/color][color=#f6b26b] ni trabajo en el proyecto [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿.
La que ha pagado este esfuerzo ha sido mi hija, ya que lo hice todo desde su pc y ella también ha puesto su semilla al renunciar a su tiempo de ocio por que su padre está haciendo algo para los demás.
No puedo imaginar el gran trabajo que hace el equipo de este administrador, yo solamente lo he traducido y uff...
Si te has leído todo esto ya has participado al menos un poco y no he escrito como un loco para que nadie lo lea.[/color]
[color=#dd7e6b][size=5][b]Gracias!!!

[/b][/size][/color][/center][center][b][u][size=6]POR QUE VORTEX?

[/color][b][u][size=6]INSTALACIÓN

[/size][/u][/b][color=#fff2cc][u]METODO 1[/u]  ([/color][color=#cc0000][size=4][b]DESCARGAR CON METODO 2 o 3[/b][/size][/color][b][color=#fff2cc])

[/color][b]3[/b]- [color=#e69138]En la pestaña de la izquierda [/color][color=#ffd966]"EXTENSIONS"[/color][color=#e69138] activa la traducción (si no está activada) y pulsa en un botón que te saldrá arriba a la derecha [/color][color=#ffd966]"(Restart)"[/color][color=#e69138] para que reinicie vortex y se apliquen los cambios.[/color]
[b]4[/b][color=#e69138]-Dentro de [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url][color=#e69138] cuando se reinicie a la izquierda pulsa en la pestaña[/color] [color=#ffd966]"SETTINGS" [/color][color=#e69138]luego arriba a la izquierda en[/color][color=#ffd966] "INTERFACE" [/color][color=#e69138] selecciona el idioma dentro de la casilla [/color][color=#ffd966]"Language"  [/color][/size][color=#e69138][b][size=3]YA ESTÁ!![/size]

description.short: Adds support for installing and managing Into the Breach mods with Vortex.
description.long:
[size=4]Into the Breach support for Vortex[/size]

This extension adds support for Into the Breach mods to the Vortex mod manager.

[quote]This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find![/quote]

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Into the Breach mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.

Using Vortex you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Into the Breach just like you install mods for any of your other Vortex-supported games.

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You should be able to immediately install the extension by finding Into the Breach in your Vortex Games list and clicking Manage. Otherwise, install it directly from the Extensions pane, by clicking Find More and searching for "Into the Breach".

[i]Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.[/i]

---

[b]Disclaimer[/b]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods, nor with Subset Games.

description.short: Vortex support for Starsector v0.95a.
description.long:
Includes support for mod version and author(s) for mods installed from file, rather than from Nexus Mods.

This extension will read mod_info.json, stripping out comments that use the '#' sign, and extract the mod version and mod author(s) from the file, allowing Vortex to display this useful information, which is normally limited only to mods that are downloaded from Nexus Mods.

Check for Updates will show updates for mods that have Version Checker support by providing a button to open the mod's forum page.

The displayed mod name will be unchanged (if downloaded from Nexus Mods) or the name of the mod's archive (if installed manually).
This is due to some mod authors releasing multiple iterations of a mod with
the same version, with the only difference being in the filename.
For example, "ModName-3.0.0-beta-1.zip" and "ModName-3.0.0-beta-2.zip" often both have a version of 3.0.0. Since the beta number is important information, it should not be replaced by the name in the mod_info.json file, which may simply be "Mod Name".

description.short:
Recent update to 5.1!
Significantly modified version of Swanndolia's lovely "Soft Dark and Classy" theme for Vortex - although, they don't look much the same...
This theme was designed to better match with my custom Desktop theme, not to look universally pretty; but feel free to download and use it if you like
description.long:
[size=3]Significantly modified version of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/38945460]Swanndolia[/url]'s lovely "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/173]Soft Dark and Classy[/url]" theme for Vortex - although, they don't look much the same...

This theme was designed to better match with my custom Desktop theme, not to look universally pretty; but feel free to download and use it if you like.

This theme requires the lovely font Walkway, which is 100% free and [url=https://www.dafont.com/walkway.font]available here[/url], if you want to use this theme.
For clarity, you only need to install the font, [i]not place it in the theme's folder [/i]for instance.[/size]


[size=5]﻿To add this theme to Vortex:
[/size]
[size=4]For Windows Users:[/size]
[size=3]
Close Vortex if it's running, go to "[u]C:\Users\<Username>\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\themes[/u]", replacing <Username> with the name Windows knows you by (which was "User", for me), and copy the folder into there.
Do not place the zip file in there.
If you set a custom install location, the folder [i]may[/i] be elsewhere; I'm unsure.

[size=4] ﻿For Non-Windows Users:[/size]
[/size][size=3]
I'm happy for you, we need less people relying on Microsoft and their software - but I can't help here, sorry.

[size=4] ﻿For Users Updating from 5.0 to 5.1:
[/size]
Close Vortex.
Install the newest version as you would normally.
Run Vortex, and change your theme from "Ambrose Black and Clear 5.0" to "Ambrose Black and Clear".
[/size][size=2]The name change was made to make the any theoretical future updates clearer, as the version number in the theme name wouldn't be mismatched with the [i]actual[/i] version number.[/size]

description.short: An extension for Vortex Showcase that adds a handful of additional formats that you can use to share your mods including CSV, Discord and a more compact Markdown format.
description.long:
This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple extension that adds a number of alternative formats to Showcase, allowing you to create more specialised showcases and share them more easily. These new formats integrate neatly and easily into Vortex Showcase so there's no additional steps.

There's plenty more information on what is and isn't available in [url=https://showcase.vortex.support/]the Showcase docs[/url], especially [url=https://showcase.vortex.support/docs/introduction/faq]the FAQ[/url].

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension directly from Vortex's Extensions pane, or from the CI builds on GitHub. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

You can then create showcases just as you normally would (from either the top bar or action bar with mods selected) and choose any of the new formats in the dialog. You can then copy/save/share your showcase like usual.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension so far.

---

[i]Disclaimer[/i]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods

description.short: Extension that adds unofficial support for S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky to Vortex.
description.long:
[b][font=Verdana]Description[/font]

[/b][font=Comic Sans MS]This extension will add [i][b]"S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky"[/b][/i] to list of games supported by [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i].[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]
[/font][font=Verdana][b][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ff7700][font=Verdana][b][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ff7700]Also, be sure to have full folder structure in [font=Georgia]"gamedata/configs"[/font], as game always checks entire folder for files. Even if it any not game related file. As Vortex, will create [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex" file[/font] in folder it creates, you will have infinity loading bug. As i'm
mentioned above, game will try to read any file that located in [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] folder, include [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex"[/font] file. (This happens only with [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] folder) I will also add fix for this, if you can't do this manually![/color][/font][/b][/font][/color][/font][/b][/font]
[font=Verdana][b]
How to install[/b][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Require [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] for this extension to work. There is 2 ways to install.
1. In [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] go to [b]"Extensions"[/b], click [b]"Find more"[/b] button, search for this extension.
2. Download manually from site and extract to [b]"C:/UserName/AppData/Roaming/Vortex/plugins"[/b]. Also you need "[b]Show hidden files and folders[/b]" set to on, before install this extension this way.
[b]
[font=Verdana]How this works

[/font][/b]Similar as [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] supported mods, just add archive of any mod, then install it. Also, root folder in archive must be [b]"gamedata"[/b]([b]"database"[/b] for some mods) not [b]"FolderName/gamedata"[/b][/font].

description.short: This extension adds support for Project Wingman mods to the Vortex mod manager.
description.long:
[quote]This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find!
Some mod authors package their mods extremely unconventionally. Vortex should warn you about these incompatible mods.[/quote]
[size=5]What is it?[/size]
This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Project Wingman mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.
Using Vortex, you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Project Wingman just like you install mods for any of your other Vortex-supported games.

[size=5]A word of warning[/size]
Project Wingman is [i][b]very[/b][/i] new and there's likely to be a lot of changes, discoveries and tweaks made to how mods work (and are managed) in the coming months. Please be patient and report any issues you find as this is being built with zero inside knowledge of the game or modding processes.

[size=5]How to use it?[/size]
You can install the extension either from the Games tab in Vortex, or by installing it directly from Vortex's Extensions pane. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.

description.short: Support for Outward
description.long:
[size=5][u]Usage[/u]
[/size]
[size=3]I recommend using a fresh installation of Outward if you want to use Vortex to manage your mods.
I also suggest installing BepInEx and PartialityWrapper with Vortex.

[/size][size=3] ﻿- Download the [url=https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx/releases]BepInEx [/url]and [url=https://github.com/sinai-dev/BepInEx-Partiality-Wrapper/releases]PartialityWrapper [/url].zip file corresponding to your system.
        - Go to the "Mods" tab on the left of Vortex
        - Drop the zip file on the bottom of the page
        - Install it like you would any other mod
[/size]
* In case the links above would be outdated, use those from [url=https://outward.gamepedia.com/Installing_Mods#BepInEx_Loader]Outward's Official Wiki[/url]﻿

[u][size=5]How it works[/size]
[/u]
[size=3]It checks if there is a[/size][b] BepInEx folder[/b][size=3] at the [/size][b]root [/b][size=3]of the zip file and if there are files in it or in its sub-folders. Basically, if you follow the current standard for BepInEx mods .zip files, it should work without issues.

[b]If the BepInEx Check is true,[/b] it copies the content in the outward folder, basically following the standard guidelines for installing bepinex mods[/size]
[quote][list=1]
[*][size=2]Download the Mod.zip file from the Files page[/size]
[*][size=2]Put this zip file in your Outward directory, so it looks like "Outward\Mod.zip"[/size]
[*][size=2]Right-click the file and "Extract Here", so it merges with the folders.[/size]
[*][size=2]Done![/size]
[/list][/quote]
[size=3][b]If the BepInEx Check is false[/b], it check if the zip file contains [b].dll, .xml or .json[/b] files. If it does, it [b]assumes it is a Partiality [/b]mod and copies every file in the [b]BepInEx/plugins [/b]folder.

if no .dll, .xml or .json files are found it throws an [b]"Incompatible Mod"[/b] error.

How the extension manages Partiality mods is a bit janky, but it should work for most of them.

If a partiality mod is not installed properly, you can make a new zip file with the .dll, .xml and .json in the BepInEx/plugins folder and the rest of the files placed correctly. Tthat way it will install it as a bepinex mod and should work.

[/size]The source code of my mods can be found here : [url=https://github.com/kikiwako/MyMods]GitHub[/url]

description.short: Adds Vortex support for Cyberpunk 2077
description.long:
Adds basic support for modding Cyberpunk 2077 with Vortex.

[b]Source maintained on Github:[/b] [url=https://github.com/thor79/game-cyberpunk2077]https://github.com/thundergod97/game-cyberpunk2077
[/url]
[b]Update as of 3/29/2021:[/b] Patch notes for 1.2 dropped (no actual patch as of when I am typing this). The new "mod" folder will break some mods that rely on the "archive/pc/patch" directory (what I originally created this extension to support), but otherwise mods are still supported by this extension so long as they are under the directory structure of the game. If the mod doesn't work, it's probably because the game changed. Removing my list of mods which support my vortex extension. I am investigating the issue with the purge/deploy buttons that are within Vortex.

[b]Update as of 2/11/2021:[/b]  I completed my 100% of the game last night. Because of that I'll be moving onto other games until something else piques my interest with Cyberpunk 2077. I will still keep an eye on the modding scene and cyberpunk news, but I won't be as active as I have been.

[b]Important Note to Mod Users:
[/b]Directory structure in the zip files in mods is getting better, but is still an issue. This extension is meant to only support extracting files to the Cyberpunk game directory. Only mods that have that structure in their zip file will work. Please let mod authors know this if you find a mod you like, but it does not yet support Vortex properly (link to this vortex extension if you like). This only applies to mods which are designed to be put into the install folder of the game (ie save files are not, so don't bother those mod authors with this)

[b]Important Note to Mod Authors:
[/b]-Your mod can be supported if you modify the directory structure of your zip file in a way that assumes the mod is extracted in the Cyberpunk game directory.
-Automatic updating of mods will only work if you post new versions of the same files. If you post new files, Vortex (via my extension) will not be able to update automatically.

------------------------------------------------

[b]Cypberpunk 2077 Support - Full Game Directory[/b]
Support for placing files in any folder under the Cyberpunk 2077 Root Directory
Requires mod zip files to have the proper folder structure to place the files correctly.
Supports the following Game stores: GoG, Steam, Epic
GoG launches via the GoG Galaxy Launcer to enable Game Store features (achievements, time tracking, friend notifications)

------------------------------------------------

[size=5][b]To Install:[/b][/size]
Two Methods now exist:

[b][size=3][b]Vortex Extensions List[/b][/size]
[/b]This has the added benefit of automatic updates
On The Extensions List, Click "Find More"
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]

Find Cyberpunk 2077 Support in the list and click Install
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]

[size=3][b]Manual download[/b][/size]
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]
Drag and drop onto the Extensions List (or Browse for your download)
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]


Restart Vortex for it to recognize it.

Go To Extensions
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]

And make sure "Cyberpunk 2077 Support" or "Game: Cyberpunk 2077" are enabled
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]   [img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]

You should then be able to find your install of Cyberpunk through the Games tab and start modding it.
[img]data:image/png;base64,[/img]

------------------------------------------------

[b]To Uninstall:
[/b]Click Remove in the extensions list

Restart Vortex, the game should no longer be supported by Vortex.

------------------------------------------------

[b]Disclaimer[/b]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods, nor with CD Projekt or CD Projekt Red.

description.short: Adds support for Valheim.
description.long:
This extension adds support for Valheim to Vortex enabling you to install and uninstall mods for the game. 

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/?BH=0&RH_ModList=nav:true,home:false,type:0,user_id:0,game_id:3667,advfilt:true,include_adult:true,page_size:20,show_game_filter:false,open:true,tags_yes%5B%5D:4198]Vbuilds[/url] (pre-made structures/constructions) are also supported, but require [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/5]BuildShare (AdvancedBuilding)[/url] to be installed. Vortex will detect when BuildShare is needed and notify you, after which you can simply install it like any other mod.


[b]New in 1.0.5:[/b]

World Saves can now be installed like any other mod but will require the mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/446]Better Continents[/url] - Vortex will notify you of this requirement.

[i]Note on uninstalling/removing new World Saves:[/i]

To remove worlds you will need to disable them in Vortex AND delete them via the ingame menu.

Known issues: due to a bug with the game/synchronisation of files, Valheim will reinstate .old files for World Saves even after they've been deleted when the game is launched and synchronisation in Steam is enabled (default). This is not a Vortex issue and will happen even if new worlds are installed/created manually. This is not a critical bug as it won't do any harm other than take up some extra space on your hard drive.



[b][size=3]How to install[/size][/b]

Simply select "Valheim" from the games list and download the extension through Vortex. (Requires Vortex 1.1.0 or newer).


[b][size=3]If you have mods installed already[/size][/b]

It is recommended to use this extension on a vanilla (unmodded) game installation of Valheim. However, if you have already installed mods using BepInEx or InSlimVML, there should not be any problems as long as you did not manually rename any of the BepInEx/InSlimVML or data folders in your Valheim directory.


[b][size=3]Note on Valheim mods using InSlimVML[/size][/b]

[i]The following does not apply for the vast majority of Valheim mods which use BepInEx (rather than InSlimVML).[/i]

For mods requiring [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/21]InSlimVML[/url], please make sure you download and install it. This process works just like installing any other mod in Vortex. Vortex will notify you if it detects a mod that requires InSlimVML.

For mod authors:

If your mod is a plugin (rather than a vbuild) and needs [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/21]InSlimVML[/url], please give your plugin a name using [b]a _VML suffix[/b]. For example, if your plugin is called MyMod.dll and it requires InSlimVML, please name it [b]MyMod_VML.dll[/b]. Vortex will read the suffix and know the mod needs to be deployed differently than a BepInEx mod.

For users:

If you are using a mod requiring InSlimVML (that is not a vbuild) that does not have the _VML suffix (so the name of the mod plugin is something like MyMod.dll rather than MyMod_VML.dll), you will need to change the modtype in Vortex to ensure the mod is deployed correctly. As of now this is a very rare use case.

To change the modtype:

[list=1]
[*]Open Vortex and select "MODS" in the side menu to bring up your mod list.
[*]Double-click on the mod you want to change.
[*]In the details panel that will pop up on the right side, scroll to the very bottom where you should see a "Mod Type" section with a dropdown.
[*]Select "InSlimVML Mod" from the dropdown.
[*]Deploy your mods (a notification should have been raised) via the notification or by clicking "Deploy Mods" in the toolbar.
[*]That's it! Enjoy your mod!
[/list]

description.short: Provides an easy way to quickly share/download/install mod setups between different Vortex instances
description.long:
[b][size=4][size=4][b]Important Notes:

[/b][/size][size=3]This extension is experimental and although it has been tested, some bugs may still be present - the extension is a personal project and is [b]NOT [/b]an official Nexus Mods extension, please report any issues you encounter on this extension page - please avoid reporting them through the internal feedback system.[/size]

What is this/How does it work ?

[/size][/b][size=3]This is an experimental Vortex extension which aims to give users the ability to automatically fulfill mod dependencies and/or share mod setups with other Vortex users. This extension allows users to "Export Dependencies" by selecting one or more mods from the mods table (Only mods downloaded through the Nexus Mods website are supported), Vortex will generate a JSON string containing all the information required to download the mods - this data can then be distributed to other users by standard copy-paste - the other users will then need to "Import Dependencies" through the action bar button in the mods page. (view gifs in image gallery)

Alternatively mod authors can distribute a generated dependency file with their mods which will immediately attempt to fulfill mod dependencies on successful mod installation (if the user enables this functionality in their settings page). The "Import Dependencies" button on the mods page can also be used to tell Vortex to search for dependency files within the current game's staging folder and attempt to fulfill them that way (for those of us that prefer full control over when the fulfillment system kicks in)

Although premium membership is highly recommended (mod download and installation is triggered automatically without any further input from the user), Non-Premium members can still benefit from this extension - Vortex will open a tab for each mod file's download page.

Example data:[/size]
[code][
  {
"archiveName": "BuildShare-5-1-4-0c-1614288309.zip",
"downloadIds": {
"fileId": 442,
"gameId": "valheim",
"modId": 5
},
"allowAutoInstall": true,
﻿"rules": []
  },
  {
"archiveName": "Better Continents-446-0-4-1-1616286717.zip",
"downloadIds": {
"fileId": 2343,
"gameId": "valheim",
"modId": 446
},
"allowAutoInstall": true,
﻿"rules": []
  }
]
[/code][size=4]
[b]What it doesn't do:

[/b][/size][list]
[*][size=3]Will not export mods sourced outside of NexusMods.com[/size]
[*][size=3]Will not export mods with orphaned/missing download archives[/size]
[*][size=3]Will not export manually added mods unless the mod's metadata is populated (use the "Guess Id" buttons to have Vortex identify your mod and pull the metadata for you)[/size]
[*][size=3]The auto-fulfill on install functionality will not use requirements defined within the mod page! (for auto-fulfill to work, the mod needs to have a ".vdeps" file included by the mod author)[/size]
[/list]
[b][size=4]How to install:[/size][/b]

[list]
[*][size=3]Find the "Dependency Fulfiller" extension inside Vortex's extensions page and install it from there. (If it's missing, refresh the extensions list manually or wait for Vortex to update it and try again)[/size]
[*][size=3]Clicking the "Vortex" button on this mod/extension page should open up the extensions page with the Dependency Fulfiller pre-selected - (again, if it doesn't show up or Vortex says it's unavailable - refresh the extensions list or wait for Vortex to refresh it)[/size]
[*][size=3](Not recommended) you can install the extension manually by downloading the archive and extracting it in your "%appdata%/vortex/plugins" folder. Please be aware that Vortex will not be able to automatically update the extension if you choose this method[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][b][size=4]Feedback:[/size][/b]

[size=3]If you have a suggestion or an issue you would like to discuss please feel free to post on this project's github page [url=https://github.com/IDCs/dependency-fulfiller/issues]https://github.com/IDCs/dependency-fulfiller/issues[/url]﻿[/size]

description.short: Adds support for State of Decay 2 into Vortex; See full description for details.
description.long:
[size=4]State Of Decay 2 + Vortex

[/size]This Vortex extension adds support for the State of Decay 2 Steam, Epic Games, and MS Store versions. 

It currently allows for:
- Install/Uninstall Mods
- Disable/Enable and Deploy Mods
- Custom Load Ordering
- Update Mods Directly In-Manager

Coming Soon:
- Custom Suggested Tools; these will be added as single-click launchers for common/useful tools for modding this game.
- Possible Cooked Support; since this is how many modders are still uploading their mods to Nexus.

[b]MOD AUTHORS:[/b] If you make mods for this game, and want your mods to be compatible, please ensure that you are using the .pak file format community standard that the rest of us use! If you need assistance with this, use one of the many tools available, or join the [url=https://discord.gg/emhxg5d]SoD2 Modding Discord[/url]. If your mod has multiple options, create an installer for it, to make it fully compatible with this system! [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/How_to_create_mod_installers]Information for this can be found here[/url]. Where it specifies to "add a folder", instead, select "add a file", and choose the appropriate .pak file for each option!

[u]IMPORTANT:
[/u]Currently only supports .pak mods inside .zip files, and "FOMOD" style installer-script-based mods, with .pak files.
[i]
IF YOUR MOD HAS MULTIPLE "FLAVOURS" [/i][b] - Please make sure you use the FOMOD style installer mentioned above![/b] Otherwise, Vortex will simply dump all of the .pak files into the users Paks folder.

[b]IF YOUR MOD IS COOKED[/b] - Please considering using the .pak community standard! This will simplify things for both the end users, and other modders. Or simply hope that I can manage to add support for Cooked mods, or a tool to make them into .pak files in the tool-buttons.

SPECIAL SHOUTOUT!
- A HUGE thank you to the Vortex developer Nagev for their support and help guiding me through some of the bugs and code while making this! This would have taken 10x longer, and been 100x harder without you!
- Additionally, a big thank you to Romans#9381 (Discord User) for their help in confirming the details needed to add the Epic Games store support!

description.short: Extension that allows mods published on the Bayonetta nexus page to be downloaded through Vortex (currently most mods needs to be updated or Vortex wont be able to recognize them properly or at all).
description.long:
[center][color=#b6b6b6]For the time being, this extension is still a work in progress[/color][/center]

[color=#ffff00][size=4][center][i] [u]How to install and set up everything for modding[/u][/i][/center][/size][/color]
[color=#f1c232][color=#fff2cc][size=4]Once the extension is installed immediately do this to avoid any issue [/size][/color][/color]
[color=#f6b26b]Go to settings[/color], then the[color=#f6b26b] MODS tab[/color] and it should look like this, place the Mod Staging Folder (where mods will be located) in the same drive where Bayonetta is located (I recommend to install bayonetta in another drive instead of the main Drive to avoid issues like crashing if it is open through steam)
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/YqZFZww8/3254.png[/img][center]
[color=#ffff00][size=4]You are ready to start modding.[/size][/color][/center][color=#ffff00][size=4]
 [/size][/color]
[size=3][color=#ff7700][center]﻿[/center][color=#f6b26b][size=3]In case of conflicts like this, where two mods have the same files, use only ONE MOD, never both at the same time. (Currently working on this issue)[/size][/color]
[/color][/size][color=#ffff00]1.[/color]
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/wvYpxnj5/conflicts.png[/img]
[color=#ffff00]2. [color=#fff2cc](Hopefully the next update will prevent users of using this method of resolving conflicts, since Bayonetta is not a bethesda game duh, there's no load order just one file (or multiple) per costume)[/color][/color]
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/pTWRqyG7/conflicts.png[/img]
[color=#00ffff][size=4]Mods working with the vortex extension are :[/size][/color]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/23?tab=files]Bayonetta Music Mod (completely)
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/32]Custom Bayonetta 2 Themed UI and minor edits (not completely, it seems its an issue with the extension not recognizing subfolders, currently working on it)
[/url][color=#fce5cd]
[/color][size=3][center][color=#ffff00][size=5][u][i][color=#fce5cd]Section only for modders [/color][/i][/u][/size][/color][/center][/size][color=#ffff00]READ THE [i][u]INDIVIDUAL COSTUMES[/u][/i] section (even if you are not a modder) because almost all mods from the Bayonetta nexus page need to be updated with a specific structure or else the mods won't work (you will need to manually extract and put the folders into a zip, 7zip or rar file if you want the mod to even work)[/color]
[size=3]

[i]If you want to create your own fomod for Bayonetta[/i][/size]
 
Follow this guide [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/How_to_create_mod_installers]How to create mod installers[/url]

Here's an example of how I made the structure of the [color=#ffff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?tab=files]FOMOD[/url][/color](this is the tool) base on this [color=#f4f4f4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/35]two[/url][/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/34?tab=files]mods[/url] from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/users/93473883]creativehandler[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/users/100080168]cookieman301[/url]:[url=https://postimg.cc/gallery/kRnPXQk] [color=#ffff00][size=4][size=3]https://postimg.cc/gallery/kRnPXQk [/size]
[/size][/color][/url][color=#cfe2f3][color=#f6b26b][size=3]If you want to open a FOMOD, open the tool and go to the dropdown menu and click on the FOMOD menu or tab (?) and open folder, select in this case A Witch With No Memories and The Famed Witch (+Extras) and it should give you an example on how to set a your own FOMOD[/size][/color]
[color=#ffe599][color=#00ffff]Note[/color]: If a [color=#00ffff]group (main folder-example-)[/color] contains more than three [color=#00ffff]plugins (subfolders[color=#cfe2f3][color=#ffe599][color=#00ffff]-example-[/color][/color][/color])[/color] set priorities from 1, 2, 3 and 4 and so on until you reach the last plugin or the first plugin wont be recognized by Vortex regardless of the "Selection" options you put[/color][/color]

-Once opened the tool, go the info tag and read the instructions to know what
does what (also be careful to not use some symbols and other stuff like
ñ or ´ when naming the folders or files, if you are familiar with
coding or programing you know what I mean)

-Don't bother with Flag Set, Conditions, Plugin Dependencies, Required Installation or
Conditional installations UNLESS ABSOLUTLY necessary, for example if you
have manage to create a new way to mod Bayonetta then yes (exaggerating
but you get the idea), by all means (which will force me to update the extension and yeah...)

[center][size=4][i][u][color=#ffff00]Individual costumes[/color][/u][/i]
[/size][/center]
[color=#00ff00]For example in case you are only replacing one costume with no variations, the folder structure has to ALWAYS[color=#b6d7a8] (for now, until I discover a way to make the extension place the files in the proper folder regardless of the mod structure)[/color] be like this [color=#b6d7a8](yes, inside the 7z file can go the wp, se, et, id or any other folder as long as it follows the structure below[/color][/color])
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/c4y4GB4G/Proper-Folder-Structure.png[/img]

Some resources for modders (is not mine)

[url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G_nSHwJez5N2w1aCI7mwiV6IF1DMP76FmSQKqjSKz3A/edit#gid=165438385]https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G_nSHwJez5N2w1aCI7mwiV6IF1DMP76FmSQKqjSKz3A/edit#gid=165438385

[/url]Join the discord server if you are interested in modding Bayonetta 1 or 2
[url=https://discord.gg/yqkrWfG]https://discord.gg/yqkrWfG


[/url]
Changes to be made:

[list]
[*]Make the extension recognizce subfolders inside the mods
[*]If two mods contains the same files, make the user choose only one, not both.
[*]Make the extension recognize file names and put them inside their respective folders without the need of a folder structure
[/list]

description.short:
This is an extension addon to use Vortex with The Riftbreaker Prologue.
Subject to Change as the game is still in Development.
description.long:
This is an extension addon to use Vortex with The Riftbreaker Prologue by EXORStudios.
Allows for easy management of mods and installation for The Riftbreaker.
﻿Makes sure that the mod is in the correct format and that they are placed into the correct folder to be used

Download the extension game support to Vortex, then [b]MANUALLY[/b] download the config and extract into the game folder (i.e. The Riftbreaker Prologue) and say [b]YES TO ALL[/b] to be able to play mods at all. 

Remember to have The Riftbreaker Prologue off Steam not the Demo one as this is the current and updated one.
Also, there is no Version checking yet so MAKE sure that the mode you download is for the correct game version that you have.

Additional Mods can be found at https://discord.gg/qkQDY3A3


[b]
MOD AUTHORS[/b]

Remember that all mods must have a .zip file archive inside the mod file name archive. 
An example is "'mymodname'.zip/'abreviatemod'_win_data.zip/'game files'"
In other words, it must be a double zip.
An actual example of how to properly pack the mods is on this page alongside the extension

As this game is an open source you can mod almost every little aspect there is, and the modded files should be first copied from the "00_win_data.zip" 
and placed into the "mod_win_data.zip" archive just as the original game files are.
You DO NOT need every file from the original game files just add what is changed from your modded files and it will overwrite the original game files.

description.short: Vortex support for the EasyNPC overhauling tool for Skyrim Special Edition. Provides mod information to the tool so that face previews and build checks work correctly.
description.long:
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/52313]EasyNPC [/url]is a tool for managing multiple (dozens, hundreds) sets of NPC overhauls in Skyrim Special Edition. It was primarily designed for Mod Organizer, but can be made to work equally well with Vortex using this extension.

To use this extension:

[list=1]
[*]Download and [url=https://github.com/focustense/easymod/blob/master/Focus.Apps.EasyNpc/Docs/getting-started.md#installation]install EasyNPC[/url]﻿, but do not run it yet.
[*]Add EasyNPC.exe as an external tool in Vortex (Dashboard → "Add Tool", you can leave everything as default after choosing the target)
[*]Add this extension to Vortex.
[/list]
Once installed, you will see a "Launch EasyNPC" button in the mod toolbar when you manage SSE:

[img]https://i.vgy.me/wZXfHI.png[/img]

Make sure you [b]always[/b] use this button to launch the app. If you try to launch it directly from the Vortex dashboard instead, you'll see a warning, and some features will not work correctly if you ignore the warning.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Technical details: [/b]Because of how Vortex organizes its staging directory, by creating one subdirectory per [i]file[/i] (rather than per [i]mod[/i], like Mod Organizer), EasyNPC requires additional information to understand the relationship between "mods" and "mod files". Launching EasyNPC with this extension ensures that it always has the most up-to-date information, so that face previews show up correctly, build checks don't report incorrect errors, and everything runs smoothly in general.

description.short: Vortex extension that allows you to hide or delete files from other mods based on a configuration kept in your modlist.
description.long:
[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Description[/size][/color]

Broom is a Vortex extension that allows you to automatically hide or delete files from your mods. To achieve this, Broom reads a configuration file that is also installed as a mod in your list. In the config file you can specify a set of rules (file names, patterns etc.) that Broom then uses to hide/delete mod files.

The idea is simple but it allows you to:

[list]
[*]resolve mod conflicts in a more automated way, allowing you to move the mods in the list independent of each other
[*]combine mods by hiding conflicting files and sharing the config without having to share the original assets
[*]keep track of file operations that had to be done manually before
[*]remove various files from a mod and share these changes without the need to share the original mod
[*]save some disk space but cleaning up unnecessary files, while keeping track of the changes at the same time
[/list]
[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Installation[/size][/color]

Install automatically with Vortex by going to the Extensions section, Find More, search for Broom.
You can also manually install by downloading the main file and dropping into the Extensions section in Vortex.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Configuration Files[/size][/color]

Before using Broom, you need to create a configuration file telling it what files it should hide/delete.

A sample file has been provided in the Optional Files section. This can be installed as a mod directly with Vortex.

To make you own, simply create a file having the [b].broom[/b] extension, archive it and drag the archive into Vortex.

The configuration files should contain a list of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glob_%28programming%29]glob patterns[/url] matching the files you want to get rid of.
Example:

[code]riftenplazabrick01*
*.png
[/code]

The first rule matches all files containing riftenplazabrick01 (like riftenplazabrick01.dds and riftenplazabrick01_n.dds) while the second one matches all files with the png extension.

You can of course have multiple config files and enable/disable them in you modlist as you wish.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Usage[/size][/color]

To launch Broom, go to MODS and press the Broom icon in the toolbar.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/270/270-1627332717-2063362335.png[/img]

Press the Find Files button and wait for it to scan your modlist. Review the matching files and press the Hide Files button.

All the matching files will be renamed with the [b].vohidden [/b]extension, preventing them to be loaded by the game.

Make sure to Deploy Mods after running Broom so that renamed files are properly managed by Vortex.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/270/270-1627332694-2058952433.png[/img]

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Settings[/size][/color]

Access the extension settings by navigating to:  Settings -> Interface -> Broom

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Un-hiding files[/size][/color]

Broom's hide operations are [color=#6aa84f][b]fully reversible[/b][/color] meaning that you can restore the files previously hidden.
All you have to do is enable the option in the settings and rerun the tool. The same configuration file is used for both hiding an un-hiding.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Deleting Files[/size][/color]

If you're really low on disk space you can choose to delete files instead of hiding them. Files are permanently deleted so if you want to restore them you need to reinstall the respective mods.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Source Code[/size][/color]

The [url=https://github.com/mihaifm/broom]source code[/url] for the plugin is available on Github under the MIT license. An MO2 version has also been uploaded [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/52097]here[/url].
This was a fun experiment writing the same plugin for both Vortex and MO2.

[size=4]**Enjoy!**[/size]

extensions.author: elpuertorro

description.short: Vortex extension to add mod support for: She Will Punish Them.
description.long:
[size=3]Adds  Vortex support to manage and install mods in the game: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem]She Will Punish Them[/url].

Will Download and install the most current stable [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/115]BepInEx from Nexus[/url] site automatically if the end user does not have it installed when using the - Mod Manager DL Button.


If you want to download and install [url=http://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx/releases]BepInEx from GitHub[/url] manually,  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/articles/1]Detailed instructions on installing BepInEx are here.[/url] provided by user, mod creator: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/users/18901754]aedenthorn[/url].
Don't forget to endorse and/or give kudos for his work and time put in the install instructions.


[size=4][b]Installation Simple method:[/b][/size]

1- Download the Ext  and install

2- Vortex will download BepInEx from here on Nexux then:

     a. If you already have BepInEx installed you are done! just go install mods as usual and enjoy the game.

     b. If you do not have it, once Vortex is done installing it, will restart, finish and you will find a mod named: "[b]Bepis Injector Extensible[/b]" 
         under Vortex's "[b]MODS[/b]" tab, [size=3][b]ENABLE[/b] IT [/size]and [b]DEPLOY[/b] as usual, then install your mods, deploy and enjoy your game.


*** If you get a Game mode error or still does not work read below



[size=4]
[b]Installation Detailed method:[/b][/size]


If Manual install:
                Click on this great [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/articles/1]very detailed tutorial[/url] by modder [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/users/18901754]aedenthorn[/url]. Don't forget to endorse him!

Or Follow my version here:

   Download lastest build of [url=http://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx/releases]BepInEx[/url] extract that folder content to the game folder ( same place as the She Will Punish Them.exe  )
                a.Run the game once and it will make some extra folders.  [b]*(See note below)[/b]
                b.Now go back to the game folder and inside the BepInEx folder there are some new folders you want "plugins" folder.
                c.Download a mod and extract the dll file and folder if it has one in to the "plugins" folder and you are done
                d.Play the game.



Auto with Vortex mod manager:

   Download the extension for SWPT on this page and install it, It will guide you and give some info and restart.
                a.Now Under "GAMES" tab you will see She Will Punish Them, pick it, might be a weird empty line, now click activate.
                b.After Ext is installed if you get a:  GAME MODE ERROR ignore it, close Vortex  and  run the game once .[b]*(See note Below)[/b]
                c.Open Vortex,go to the games tab and activate SWPT again, if done right you should now have a new tab called "MODS" click it.
                d.You should already have 1 mod there "Bepis Injector Extensible"  Enable it, let it do it's thing, if not repeat the steps.
                e.Now go nexus [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem]SWPT[/url] mod page pick your mod and just click on the button for downloads that says "Vortex"
                   it will download direct into Vortex.
                f.Now click on "Never Installed" it will install, then it will say "disable"  click on it, now will make it "enable", then Deploy.
                g.Now launch and play.



 Info for newbies if you want to read:

The first part of Vortex installation( the Ext ) is the get Vortex to manage the game,
BepInEx is what we need to run the mods for Unity.
It  is only a 1 time set up, you do not have to do it again, then is just click a Mod you want, enable and play.
Also good about the Vortex method is, if you ever need to clean the folder, with "Purge" Cleans out you mods and it leaves only the original files in the event you need to verify integrity or what not and then you can Re-deploy all or some if needed  .

Hope that helps.

[b]NOTE:[/b] *IMPORTANT*   Both Methods after BepInEx gets installed you need to -->[b]RUN THE GAME ONCE[/b]<--, so BepInEx can create the folders it needs. also for manual users  BepInEx [b]V 5.4.12  Does not work[/b], so if using that build update it.

   

[/size]
[size=2]
[/size][size=4][size=2][b][size=4]Credits:[/size][/b]
[size=3]Can not thank [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/users/31179975?tab=about+me]Pickysaurus[/url] enough, not only by helping me personally with this but also by sharing all the information he does to make this and other mods possible!!
So again THANK YOU!

Please go give him kudos and support his creations!

Also thanks to the BepInEx Dev team: Bepis ([url=http://www.nexusmods.com/users/65815626?tab=about+me]bbepis[/url]) , DeathWeasel1337, js6pak and
ManlyMarco, without them and their work this would not be possible at all.


[size=2][size=4]Source code for BepInEX[/size]
[url=https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx]https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx[/url]
[/size][/size][/size][/size]

extensions.name: She Will Punish Them - Vortex Extension
